text: Pours a clear copper color. Very thin head that disappeared into nothing. Hoppy and malty at the same time aroma. Caramel, malty, a citrusy hop flavor.

Kapsel is drinking a Behemoth (2016) by 3 Floyds Brewing Company

Herbaciane, trochę biszkoptowe, mocno nachmielone, nie podszedł mi jakoś bardzo.

An outstanding barleywine. Very powerful, very boozy, very sweet beer. Nice amount of hops that arent completely swallowed up by the malts. Tried with Al, Brian, Brandon, and Josh at Local Option in 2017 after ASEH.
Sampel butelki w Chmielarni. Białe owoce, drewno i wanilia. Smak słodki, lekko cukrowy, owocowe i wanilia jak w aromacie, w tle trochę taniczne. Smaczne.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Behemoth by 3 Floyds Brewing Company at Chmielarnia Marszałkowska

Barrel aged. Dziwne piwo, jak triple ipa z przejrzalymi owocami i cynamonem. Nie do konca mi podchodzi. Slodkie. Ciekawe. Inne.Rami Rami is drinking a Behemoth (2016) by 3 Floyds Brewing Company at Wał Gocławski

Potwierdza mi sie - to zupelnie nie moj klimat i tyle. Choc niewatpliwie jak komus paleta podpasuje to same zalety ;)

Bottle shared with the KL tastiing group. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is toffee caramel malt. The flavour is moderate sweet with a light, metallic hop, light fruit, alcohol bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Draft at Bobs Bar: deep nut-brown pour, beige head. aroma of hops, bready, dark fruit. tastes are sugary molasses, but not too sweet overall. caramel, herbal, toasted malts, brown sugar. background boozey. bittersweet finish. creamy palate and easy drinking for such a big brew.
22oz purple wax 2015 bomber thanks to sheepdog. Poured a caramel brown color with a small foamy off white head. Aroma/taste of caramel, peaches, rotted citrus, grass, and Amber maltiness.

On tap@: pours deep copper, slightly clear with foamy off-white head. Aroma-flavors: intense malts notes, which takes on toastedd toffee, caramel, supported with huge hop notes, which takes on citruses. There are also fruity esters....finish is slightly dry, bitter, body is full, texture is soft, carbonation is moderate.

(Three Floyds Behemoth) Bottle 650 ml at home, vintage 2012. Served into a snifter, ABV 10.5% according to the label.
Deep red colour on the body, slightly hazy, small tan head on top, good density and average retention.
Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, figs, dates, alcohol, malts, some peach and apricot even, sugars, light orange marmalade.
Taste is sweet as expected, the alcohol feels like itsmore than 10+%, dark fruits, sugars, marmalade, orange, faint pine on the finish, apricots.
Medium thick body with soft carbonation.
Really good barleywine.

0,65l bottle at home from a trade. Blue Wax (so I assume 2014). dark brown color, small off-white head. smells of sherry, caramel, nutty, marzipan, some hop notes, oranges, light alcohol. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes a bit old hops, caramel, spices, nutty, light sherry, light alcohol, some wood, bit peppery. finishes lightly sweet with some alcohol and notes of caramel, spices and some sherry notes. quite good one, maybe a bit too old / a bit too oxidized for me, but overall still nice stuff.

650ml bottle (white wax) @Brasserie 4:20. Pours copper with a little head. Aroma of malt, caramel, toffee, orange peel, raisins, herbs, oxidation. Flavour is malty, medium sweet with a distinctive bitterness, a bit too "short" in the mouth, not so rounded. Medium body, a bit watery, soft carbonation. Not aged well.
Amber color with beige head. Aroma is really hoppy for a barleywine, earthy and resiny. Taste starts slightly malty but overall its really hoppy. Really fresh tasting barleywine.
Shared BOTTLE. Smooth milky caramel, vanilla and traces of fruity hops. Warming alcohol and smooth bitterness.

DLD taster. Big bold black beautiful, bountiful, beertastic, Barleywine. Another solid product from 3F...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromas of sweet malts, toasted sugars, melted caramel, sugar covered plums, tangerines, dates, toffee, deep amber malts, barley, wheat and intense pines and resin. Pours a darker copper with a apricot tint and thin foam and lace. Taste brings intense sweetness, sugars, deep fruits and crisp caramel upfront. Hops are immediately present afterwards with heavy bitterness, pines, resins, oils and tangerine notes. Finishes dry and hoppy with a noticeable booziness, Overall, very impressive. Well balanced between heavy barley wine malts and american style hops. A+ rating.

Slight ruby brown color, clear. Small tan head. Molasses, light vanilla. Pine resin. Some earthiness. Sweet, some bitterness. Heavy body, chewy. Oily. Long finish. Great.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. 2016 black glitter wax vintage. Pours brown with a white head. Huge hop presence on the nose with caramel, toffee and a touch of maple. Sweet hoppy flavor with a great mouthfeel. Yeah its hoppy for a barleywine but what do you expect from 3 floyds? No hops? Pfft, come on now. Fantastic brew.
Huge brown sugar, caramel, and candied orange aromas. Taste is grapefruit, orange peel, pine tar, caramel, brown sugar, and dates. 2016 black glitter wax.

2016 black glitter wax. Pours a royal red-amber gold with creamy short-lasting off-white head. Nose of pungent, dripping apricot and maple-y honey, fruitcake glaze, desserts upon desserts wafted by a big booze hotness. Smells a bit like a diabetic hulk-sized alpha king. Flavor presents the same with a refined and easy bitterness, initially a big syrupy body with a triumphantly clean, non-cloying finish. As it warms the alcohol can make your tongue feel like an asphalt parking lot on a July day. Still has that trademark FFF candy hoppiness flavor. This one doesnt disappoint.

Bottle split at home with JF, IP trade with the Baldwizzard, 13/02/16. Yellowwax so guess 2006 rew.
Lightly hazed orange amber with a well appointed beige covering. 
Nose is caramel xauce, light spice, fruit cake, raisens, hoppy underpin, light booze tunes
Taste comprises Xmas cake, light spice, toffee, earthy hop, biscuit crumble, light pine, dark fruit rinds. 
Full bodied, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in a boozey balanced close. 
Solid BW .. good dose of hops without being OTT ..has held up extremely well for 9+ years.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Bottle pour from Lincoln - thanks heaps mate! Golden brown pour. Aroma is sugary sweetness. Taste is sticky caramel, sweetness, delicious - so smooth! Overall - great easygoing barleywine. Solid stuff.

Pours hazy, barely translucent honey golden. Aroma presents malty, honey and fruity tones. Honey, malt and fruity tones round out a pleasing flavor. Mouthfeel features firm body and good fizz. This is a behemoth.

Enjoyed at 101 Beer Kitchen December 28, 2015 in a snifter.

Look - Very light brown with a red tint. See through. Awesome finger of thick bubbled head. A lot of lacing. I was expecting much darker.

Smell - Ginger bread. Cherry. Bread. Hop. Lighter fruits. Raisin. Cinnamon.

Taste - Ginger. Cinnamon. Cherry.

Feel - At 10.5% it is very smooth. Not as carbonated on swallow as it looks but sits a little bubbly. Little burn.

Overall - Surprised by the color. Hops come through just enough. A lot going on.

bottle shared at our big bottle share tasting. 2013 orange wax bottle. poured e clearer orange to amber colour with a long lasting white head on top. aroma is very hop forward, with some sweet dried apricots, and stone fruits shining trough. sweet toffee, and sticky caramel, and just a ton of sweet fruited candy sugar. taste is very bitter, still a lot of old bitter hops and dried apricots. mouthfeel is pretty full bodied. but im not a fan. to hoppy for a barley wine. quite a mess

Aroma - caramel malt, resinous hops, figs, raisins, and other drupe fruits, and light alcohol.
Appearance - ochre body with tan head, minor lacing
Taste - resiny hops, caramel malt, fruit - fig and raisin, and booze
Palate - full body, slick texture, carbonation is average, harsh hoppy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle enjoyed @ a friends cottage. Pours murky golden with an off-white head. Aroma is floral, caramel, citrus, bready, hops and honey. Flavour is medium sweet and bitter. Full bodied, thick texure, soft carbonation. Finish is warming alcohol, quite hoppy and surprinsingly easy to drink.

Enjoyed at an all barley wine tasting at Traviss house on February 21. 22 oz, 2012 vintage. The pour is an orangey brown with a nice frothy off-white head and some good lace. The aroma is surprisingly hoppy with a lot of brown sugar. The hops almost make me want to think this is a big IPA. The alcohol seems to be hidden by the sugar for sure. The The flavor is big on hop bitterness and a good citrus fruity zing. There is a strong yeastiness on the back end. The mouth feel is thicker and well carbonated with a lingeringly bitter, roasted hop aftertaste that really hangs around

Flaska på Monks Café, Stockholm. Det stod att den var från 2006, men vaxet var turkost. Ljus, lite grumlig öl. Doftar som en lagrad amerikansk barley wine ska, karamell, lite honung, en aning torkade frukter, lite humle. Smak av detsamma, endel beska finns kvar. God men inte något utöver det vanliga när det kommer till lagrade, beska barley wines, vilket jag dock gillar.
Bottle at all killer no filler. Pours murky brown with a frothy offwhite head. A lot sediment observed. Aroma is caramel and hoppy. Taste sweet caramel, slightly bitter hops, a touch of citrus.

Back in the day I would of loved this. The reason people say that Ipas turn into barley wine. Lots of hops and caramel malt. I found it easy to drink despite how big this was. Hoppy barely wine, not really my thing anymore.
22oz bottle pours a brown color with a bit if frothy head. Strong caramel. Less of a sweet malt bomb than other big barley wines. Alcohol well masked. Delicate complex flavors.

From old notes. From tap at Mikkellers CBC12. Amber color with off white head. Malty aroma, caramel, bready, light citrusy fruity, Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body soft carbonation
This was pretty hoppy. Doesnt taste like your typical barleywine. It was more like an ipa but I would drink again.

Pours murky brown with small tan head. Aroma of oak and whiskey. Sharp. A bit too much oak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Stout Barrel House. Tawny amber, low golden head. Chewy toffee and piney hops, full bodied with a long bitter finish. A great American barley wine.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle, 2015 release so quite fresh, 04/21/2015. Pours a ruby brown color, dense medium head with sticky lacing. Aroma of citrus with heavy grapefruit and noticeable tropical notes, sticky sweet toffee keeping pace with mildly resinous pine. Taste is grapefruit and thick bitterness balanced by sweet caramel malts and citrus zest, lingering grassy pine notes. Thick body, chewy. Really nice, a standard for the American style.
Amber to brown with tan head. Raisin currant licorice and then usuall TF big hop nose. Flavor dark fruit caramel and hop bitterness.
Just an amazingly enjoyable barley wine. Such balance as in all three Floyds brews. Enjoy.
Bomber from the brewery thanks to respertftw. Hazy,dark caramel with particulate. Syrupy hop aromas. Potent hops and a dried plum and candi syrup finish.

Bottle, across several vintages. Pours an amber color with a tan head. Somewhat oily in appearance. Aromas are of sweet raisins, dates, alcohol, bitter/earthy hops and a light roast. Taste is incredibly sweet. Cloying at times. This thing is over-hopped to the gills! Tropical fruit waves come through, but does little to calm the sweet malt that continue to linger and cling to my palate. Not a big fan of this one, but I can see why some would like it.

Tasted from draft. Pours a deep amber with off white head. Aroma is citrus fruits, caramel and some dark fruits as well. Tastes almost like an imperial IPA. You still get the dark fruits and caramel/toffee sweetness but there is citrus and piney flavors to balance. Nice mild bitterness that barleywine often lack. Excellent beer as usual from three floyds. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 bottle Big thanks to Nelson, long time want! Hazy straw orange white head. Fruity yeast strawberry. The booze is very present but well balanced. This beer is a great example of a barley wine. A true classic.

22oz bottle poured into a hurricane snifter. The aroma is a stark grapefruit blended with a secondary note of bread crust. Orange juice comes through as it settles with minor notes of grass, a touch of toffee, and a mild tropical / pineapple note. Its a murky, caramel brown topped by a slightly off white, soft soapy head. It leaves an abundant, messy lace, and retains a soapy thick ring with a messy, creamy surface. The taste is a medium high sweet with a medium high bitter backend; nicely balanced. The beer is smooth and viscous -  syrupy - with a foamy carbonation. The medium full body is citrus upfront with a spice and pine zing to it. More caramel malt shows up late in the bottle, and it finishes with citrus zest - notably grapefruit - and a clean, spice and resin quality. The aftertaste is dry, clean, and astringent with fresh notes of pine and resin and a bit of wax.
2010 version. Color is orange and white head. Aroma of hop and sugar. Taste sticky toffee and grass.

Poured from bottle into Teku glass. Aroma is typical of a 3F brew, lots of hops. At first I wasnt expecting much because Im not really that into the 3F use of hops in non-IPA styles anymore (Did not love Alpha Klaus or Blot out the Sun), but from the first sip I knew this was good. The hops are present, especially their bitterness, but theyre well balanced by the massive malt backbone. Sweet, citrusy, and caramel, all at once. a very nice complexity that kept the beer from just coming across as a DIPA. Thinner body than I expected, but it worked well. ABV not even noticeable. Would love to try this with 2-3 years on it.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
Had on tap at 3 Floyds. Fairly sweet flavors of hop, citrus, and malt. Decent but too sweet for me - just not my style.

This borderlines on double IPA for me because of its intense bitter hop flavor. Which is not necessarily a bad thing. Nice sweet caramel and big hop aromas. Flavors are smooth sweet caramel followed by a hop explosion. Awesome stuff. No alcohol detected at all.

Pours with a decent head. Smells great, tastes great. Extremely well balanced, nothing overwhelming the other. Tastes of hops, citrus, mild alcohol taste, slightly bitter finish. A really great beer.
Had from a bottle.
Bottle shared with plovmand. Bottle with yellow wax. Hazy amber body with a tiny head. Plums, raisins, brown sugar, crackers, dark fruit. Smooth and soft. Really delicious despite the 7 years of age.

Bottle. Yellow wax. Shared with Hallinghansen. It pours hazy deep Amber with a medium off white head. Loads of sweet cracker like malt and hops with dried fruity notes. The flavor is really malty with rich nutty and caramel notes. Ripe dried fruits and sweet biscuits. I find a mysterious off notes I cant describe but hell its 8 years old. Still going strong!!

Hazy brown orange. Hoppy, citrus, ripe fruit. Medium body, cotton candy, citrus taste. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 bottle courtesy of warpedsilver... Caramel amber brown in color... Aroma of raisins, tomato, dark fruits.... Flavor of overripe fruits, raisins, caramel, oak... Light citrus hop notes that persists onto palate... Amazingly good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

APPEARANCE - Ruby red clear, lacking head. 
NOSE - Clearly a barely wine. Good age smell. 
FLAVOR - Smooth as my backside. 
NOTES - Excellent barley wine. I hear it's better at 3 years than 8 (thanks Shigegado).

How: Bottle, 2009 vintage..
Where: SMÖF 2014.
Appearance: Dark amber colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Malt, fruit, citrus, apricots, mango, alcohol, peach, tropical fruit.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, tropical fruit, grass, hops,

2013 bomber. Pours dark amber with some sediment near the end. Aroma of orange peel, honey, hops, and prune. Tastes very smiling and sweet with an aggressive, hoppy/boozy bitter finish. Flavors of brown sugar, orange, hops, and slight dark fruit hints. Very nice sipper.

"style-wise this sure seems like an english style. sweet toffee and caramel flavors and aroma, some fruit too. way more than the hops, which were just enough to balance it. very well done. no idea what the vintage was. thanks pfoxyjohn. "
Man how they do this, so rich yet so hoppy, not bitter astringent hoppy but big fruity mango hoppy, then such a big rich malt backbone. Worthy of a 6
2012 red wax. Pours copper with a thin white head. Aroma of big malt, caramel, butterscotch, and maple. Taste is malty with a touch of hop bitterness. This is a malt bomb but in a good way.
Pours murkey dark amber with a lasting off white head. Taste has notes of caramel, raisins and oatmeal. Finish is prunes.

65 cl bottle @ home (2014 - blue wax). Pours cloudy amber with a little sediment and an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, malt, dried fruit, pine, and citrus - with a slightly bitter finish.

Brown bottle, 650 ml, 2006 vintage, trade with rfraga7 (thank you!) savoured on August 8 2014; eye: brown with a caramel hue, hazy, tiny sheet of khaki head, light lacing; nose: resinous hops, malt, caramel, light fruity, pine, fig, light alcohol; mouth: resinous hops, malt, caramel, slight fruity, pine, lots of astringency, bittering hops, fig, light alcohol, finale in bittering hops with good presence of malt and caramel, full body, quite bitter, mildly sweet, harsh texture; overall: fine and as hold up pretty well

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 650 ml, millésime 2006, échange avec rfaga7, savourée le 8 août 2014; il : brune avec une teinte caramel, trouble, petite couverture de mousse kaki, légère dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, malt, caramel, léger fruité, pin, figue, léger alcool; bouche : houblon résineux, malt, caramel, très léger fruité, pin, beaucoup dastringence, houblon amérisant, figue, léger alcool, finale en houblon amérisant avec bonne présence de malt et de caramel, corsée, pas mal amère, moyennement sucrée, texture rugueuse; en résumé : bien et a bien vieilli

Bottle, 2013 version. Pours light hazy amber with a creamy white head. Aroma of caramel, resin, orange zest, peach, passionfruit, soap. Taste is medium sweet caramel and ripe fruits, medium bitter grassy and piney all the way. Finish is medium grassy bitter with a caramel background, some alcohol coming through as it warms up. Creamy medium/full bodied with low/medium carbonation.

Been wanting to try this for a while. Thanks for the bottle, Ray! This hits all the right notes for a barleywine in its aroma and taste. Sweet and robust, with a noticeable hoppy brightness. A very special barleywine.
650 ml bottle, vintage 2009. Hazy amber with off white head. Aroma of marmalade, peach and lots of caramel. Taste is sweet, caramel, fruit, marmalade, apricot and pine. Nice

2013 release on tap at DLD 2014. Pour is burnt orange with a very small white head. Aroma and flavor of molasses, dark caramel, resin hops, toffee, and light biscuit. Finish has a lot more hop presence with more fruit flavors.

2014 - blue wax.
Pour murky nutty brown, with a small frothy off white head.
Aroma is really hop forward. when poured, this seems like a "triple IPA", but it warms up, the malty caramel notes comes through. Also slight dark fruits and some mint in here as well.
The taste is sweet, but has plenty of hoppy bitterness to it as well. Medium n slightly sticky body, with a semi-flat carbonation. 
I know this is what American BW is all about, but I dig my BWs more sweet. Oh well, shame on me.

Settles a hazy light copper tone i the glass with a beige head. The aromas here a very very fresh. Big hop profile coming through. I think this was brewed in march 2014. This could just as weel have been a trippel ipa. Now to the taste.. Ok here we have a maltier background with a little caramel and hazelnut. But it is still very very herbal and piney, very hoppy. The mouthfeel is lively and has a medium body. The finish is.. (you guessed it) hoppy.

2012 bottle aged 2yrs. Pours a hazy dark reddish orange color with sticky off white head that laced my glass. The aroma is of a hoppy citrus with defined tones of sweet malted carmel grains. From memory, age has tamed the hop driven scents than fresher version. Because of the age to this brew the carmel aroma is more dominating with a pleasant moderation of herbel and citrus like hop scents. In tasting I picked up a very welcoming bitterness with a nice blending of sweet sugary grains and booze. There is a medium body to this beverage, making it very drinkable. The finish is desirable even with a boozy dryness that lingered. Overall I was surprised that this aged well. Honestly I thought when I had this fresh that it could not get any better but the behemoth proved me wrong, you got to love the barleywine style.

Bottle, 2012 version. Hazy hazelnut brown with a small tan head. Caramel, cookies, berries, dry flowers, figs, honey. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Long warming finish. Surprisingly soft and mellow and drinks kind of easy. Deserves its place on the top list of barley wines.

Dark hazy amber pour with an off-white head. Big hops aromas with notes of dark fruits. Taste is hoppy upfront but as the beer warms up it mellows and the sweet malts come forward. Abv is well-hidden. Pretty good, Im definitely interested to see how well this one ages.

bottleshare thanks to DexterCat. Yellow wax Ohio version. Nose is full of hops and sticky malt. Slightly oxidized sherry. Some dark fruit and vinous character. Slight carbonation. Sticky on the lips. Pretty tasty.

Yellow wax (2011 OH only release). Pours a murky orange-brown color, minimal head. Boozy, sweet, grainy, light fruity notes in the aroma. Grainy, semi-sweet, caramel malt, and a decent amount of alcohol/boost flavor in the finish.

Bottles hate thanks to drewfiss. 2011 yellow wax Ohio only bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow and orange. Aroma is strong boost, lots of sugar. Taste is surprisingly not that strong, mild. It does warm the throat a bit though. Really lite on the pallets too, again I am surprised. Really nice beer.
Reddish color with little aroma. Surprisingly hoppy, but Ive come to expect this from 3F. Overall decent but not worth the $18 we paid for a bomber.
Small amount of carbonation. Brown reddish body. Not too much aroma. Some alcohol grainy smell. Slightly fruity taste. Some sweet bread notes. Its decent.
Behemoth pours a wonderful dark brown with a thin head and good lacing. This is extremely well balanced, with plummy and toffee notes. Opens up as it warms, as with any solid barleywine.
This is a very balanced beer. 2009 release. Some citrus in the aroma with light caramel. Taste is in some way complex. A lot of different caramel notes. Low carbonation.
En fantastisk barley wine med en fantastisk komplexitet dessa 12% känns inte alls, gött.
Draft while in line for DL. Hoppy barley wine. Decent and tasty. Words words

5/IV/14 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - BB: n/a, 2008 vintage (2014-342) Thanks to Adam Jackson for the bottle!
Saved it for my 100th Barley Wine rating, was not disappointed! :-)
Clear orange beer, creamy off-white head, little stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: sweet, orange peel, floral, some dried fruits, sugary. MF: soft to no carbon, full body. Taste: sweet sugary start, very fruity, citrus, dried fruits, bit of honey, little bitter. Aftertaste: honey, sugary touch, floral, nice piny bitterness, citrus, some vanilla.

22oz bottle with purple/lavender wax. 2011? 
Aroma is full of caramel notes with some toasted bread, toffee and a light roast character. Some burnt sugar and hints of honey. Light citrus and pine hoppiness, but the hops have mostly faded. Light alcohol spice. 
Pours a somewhat cloudy, copper and amber with a small tan head that quickly disappears. Faint lacing and long legs. 
Flavor has a moderate sweetness with lots of caramel and toffee. Some light treacle notes. Moderate toasted bread and nuttiness. Hints of roast and smoke. Moderate bitterness with light citrus and pine resin; again the hops have really faded. Light honey notes in the finish along with hints of alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a really nice barleywine that has asked really well. I like the way the malt character had integrated and the heart had faded. Im not a fan of super hoppy barleywines so the she had helped in that way too. Oxidation is only showing hints of honey.

What more can i say than what the others have said, this should be the base line for all barley wines, solid overall. Nice caramel, toffee flavors, not overly sweet, a little booze thrown in, not overly boozy, solid barley wine.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2014 Served: 22 oz bottle
Vintage: 2013 Blue Wax Cap
Look: pours a cloudy dark amber. Little to no head off white
Smell: sweet. Fruity. Cherries. Strawberries.
Taste: heavy alcohol. 
Feel: good carbonation leaves a thick film like an IPA. 
Overall: good beer. Very hoppy. Like the 
First drank: 6/14/14 Jenna's graduation.

Bottle (blue wax) to glass. A deep amber color. Smells like a hoppy 3F beer. A full mouth feel, and balanced taste. At the very end, a slight raisin sweetness. Nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blue Wax

A- Pours a deep orange huen with a nice, frothy head.

S- Sweet, light fruit, molasses, hints of date.

T- Lots of malt, starts off with deep brown sugar and raisin and moves to a huge hop back end that is very bitter and has a bit of an alcohol burn.

M- Thick with medium carb.

D- This could certainly use some aging but I liked it a lot. The look kind of threw me off but it really comes together.

Bottle from Rileys Wines of the World in downtown Madison. This has been sitting in my pantry for some time, and I was waiting for a special occasion to drink it, but fuck that. This poured out leathery brown in color. It had a huge caramel malt bouquet, with a subdued pine hop aroma. A pungent booze aroma leaped out, and made this nearly cloying. Sometimes, too much of something is not a good thing. The flavor was more of the same - booze, caramel malt, pine hop. Rather messy, in my opinion. It seems as though its just trying to be bold, and big, without being harmonized. Im glad to have finally tried this, but I cant say that this stood out as one of the top barley wines Ive ever tried. It had the texture and appearance of a great barley wine, however.

Popped after a long HMOG weekend. This is something I have been wanting to try for quite some time and finally was able to get one in a trade. Pours a murky orange/brown with an off white head. Smell is big sweet caramel malty, hops, bit of light biscuit. Taste rides that perfect line of sweet caramel, citrus hops, fruity, some bits of welcome booze. I love big sweet American barleywines and this is a damn fine example.

Bomber, thanks to Jeff. Pours somewhat murky brown. Aroma: caramel, herbal and resinous hops, some toffee but overall aroma is muddled -- a murky mix of big flavors that feel like they were thrown together just because. Taste: all kinds of meh. Palate: full body, soft carbonation. Overall: muddy.
2013 22oz bomber pours a hazy light brown with an off white head. Pretty hoppy for a year old. It almost tasted like an old ipa over a barley wine. Still great beer very sweet malt taste.

Poured from a red wax bomber bought at 3F in 2012 into a 3F Teku glass amber red with a lacy beige head that laces beautifully down the side of the glass.
Aroma is hoppy yet highly sweet. Very faint alcohol.
Flavor is molasses thick sweet with lots of citrus hops like a sugar pine tree. 10.5% ABV well hidden. Bitter sweet finish.
Extremely well balanced. Fave barley wines are American & this one is pretty much PERFECT!!

On tap at 3F. Pours an auburn color with no head. Aroma is molasses and malts. Taste is pleasantly sweet and hides the ABV well. Palate is well balanced with subtle hints of sugar, malts and molasses. One of the better barleywines I have had.
Bottle shared by dodgrblu at california 10k event. Poured ruby red with big hop aroma. Taste was slightly roasted with a big hop finish. Excellent

Rerateed 26.02.2014, 0,65l bottle (blue wax, blood fresh 2014 edition) sampled @ MAD Beer Brewing release @ Mielcke & Hurtigkarl:
Small slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh fruity, hop pellets, newly cut lawn, leafs, citrus peel, hints of pine needles. Taste is slightly concentrated fresh grassy, hop pellets, leafs, grass, pine needles, caramel malts, sap, dried fruits. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice enough, way too fresh for a barleywine, and maybe more in the triple IPA direction as it is now. (Rerated from 11.05.2012, tap @ CBC).

2014 bottle. Orange-amber pour with a white head. Malt-heavy aroma with sweet caramel, orange peel, and a bit of oak. Awesome sweet boozy taste of smooth caramel, oak resin, light citrus, some toffee, and a solid amount of both piney and earthy hops. Great sticky texture. A top-flight barleywine.
2014 I am not one to normally drink barley-wine style beers, but this was a treat. Not overly sweet, with a nice balance of malt and surprisingly hops. A beer to try. Nicely done FFF.

2014 blue wax that had me thinking this bottle was 4 years old, still excellent though. Malty, alcohol aroma. Hazy amber color. Taste is sweet, caramel malt with a nice hops bitterness. Extremely well balanced and very easy-drinking for such a high ABV. Beyond excellent.
Blue wax. 2009 batch. Thanx too three floyds and mikkel! Sent of apple, cinnamon, chocolate, sweet. Nice. Robust body. Big body. Malts. Some apple. Nice beer

Thank you highwine! Pours a hazy amber thin white head. Malty caramel swamp alcohol aroma. Big malty caramel brown sugar and molasses taste with a bitter dry finish that lingers. Medium body light to medium carbonation. Wish I shared the bottle but fk it.

(bottle - 22 oz) Cloudy copper pour. Surprisingly hoppy aroma. Tons of citrus notes in it as well. Flavor is malty, naturally, and very hoppy which was quite surprising. Not so much a barley wine as it was a really big Imperial IPA almost. Im curious to see what age does to it.

2013 bottle. Dark reddish orange with a white head. huge citrus hop, grapefruit and malt in the nose and on the palate. Sweet and super hoppy. Like a malty triple IPA almost. I hate barleywine but I will definitely be drinking this again

Most recent batch, I believe (2014?) Aroma: Big grapefruit and a little pineapple; rich, intense caramel. Appearance: Dark, murky cola brown with a ring of bone head. Flavor: A bit more balance than the nose suggests; the malts fight back, but the hops (mainly grapefruit) are ever-present. Palate: Full body, tacky texture, average carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: Worthy of its reputation.
Really good barley wine. Real easy on the palaye with a really nice taste. Expect nothing less from 3 floyds.

On draft at Yogis in Bloomington. Pours dark brown with a thick foamy white head. First sip as smooth and sweet with a strong carmely malty taste, very delicious. Best Barleywine I've tried to date. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at RBWG grand tasting! Pours a slightly cloudy copper brown with minimal head or lacing. Aroma is malty and sweet, but not crazy on either and no hint of the booze. Taste follows, thick and full, light carbonation. Very nice, especially for a barley wine.
22 ounce bottle from the Wife at Capitol Beer and Taproom 10 K celebration.

Orange-waxed 2013 bottle pours deep red-amber with a decent head. 
Attractive aroma is a bit too flowery, giving a hint of perfume. 

Alcohol is partly hidden, but still drinks like 10% ABV.

Feel: a little hot on the tongue, this would no doubt benefit from some aging. 
Medium body and carbonation.
Dark amber pour with almost no head. Strong caramel sweetness and grapefruit hops. Oily, sticky palate. A little too sweet and the alcohol isnt as well integrated as some other barley wines.
Unclear amber of color with a off white head. An aroma of malt, bread, sweets, caramel, citrus and grapefruit. A flavor of malt, bread, hops and grapefruit.
Haven't liked any barleywines before. But 3 Floyd's as usual, changed my mind. Draft at Eataly. Cloudy light red color. Sweet raisin plum and fruity taste. Hides the high ABV well too.

Pretty sure this was 2013 and possibly kbudd brought it during August tasting. Nose: Sweet orange and brown sugar, lime, 
T: malt , light brown sugar, weak molasses, orange, light acid, all around excellence.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2014 2013 Orange Wax ... Hazy amber pour with a thin off white head and sticky lacing.... aroma of lemons and mangos/lots of citrusy hops and as these age piney and sweet caramel malts come out .... taste is of deep caramel malts, mango, orange, juicy fruits and citrusy hops with a bitter hoppy/malty balance of flavors .... bit of warming booze in the finish .... mouthfeel is lively bitter and slick with a medium body .... def aging one of these to see how the hops mellow out .... Taste becomes more of a chewy caramel and of piney hops as it ages. Boozy edge disappeared with age

Bottle share. Aroma is sweet, with alcohol coming across on the nose. Big and chewy, extremely sweet.
(from notes)

2013 vintage
Golden Amber / red
Nose is loaded with Tobacco and super spicy peppercorn. 
Very bitter beer.like this was once a hop bomb and just faded and very intensely chewy. A lot of very biscuity and loaded with tobacco and cloves. Too intense actually in sweetness, caramel and tons of spice.

22 oz. bottle that is one year old. Hazy Amber color with decent level of carbonation. Lace down the side of the glass. Nose is Crystal malts, toffee, orange spice and tobacco leaves. Flavor is much the same with plenty of bitterness. Tobacco leaves mixed with toffee and caramel. Level of bitterness is real high. I guess it should sit a bit longer. Not buying into the hype on this one.

Thanks to lurchingbeast for this one: AS AN EXTRA!!
White wax: 2011

A: Pours a whiskey orange with a three finger head which resonates for quite some time. The head is burnt cream color of thick, fine viscosity. Lacing is excellent.

S: The smell of hops burst toward me upon cracking this beer even before pouring. Pine, resin, grapefruit, caramel malts. Pretty standard combo, but well presented.

T: Sweet, alcoholic, sweet, alcoholic. The citrus of the hops comes through after a bit, but nonetheless, the alcohol is not well addressed in this beer. 

M: Slick and medium bodied with low-medium carbonation. The beer leaves the mouth slick for a moment, then dry for the finish.

D: The beer is okay. The alcohol is poorly concealed. Im disappointed. Too sweet for a fresh Barleywine. I can see why many enjoy the beer (presuming those who like this also find Hopslam and TwoHearted, Pliny to be the best of the best out there - sweet). Cant say its for me though.

Serving type: bottle

02-25-2011
22oz bottle pours brownish red-orange with a small head. Nose is fruit earthy apple, syrup, figs. Taste is malty caramel and earthy fruit, plum, raisin. Finish is fruity, bready.

Bottle thanks to JBPortland! Pours a caramel brown color with a bit of gaseous eggshell bubbles. The nose is caramel popcorn, booze and a bit of herbal medicinal weirdness. The palate follows the nose with round sweet booze, toasted caramel and a stale hop bitterness that rolls into a bit of a weird medicinal artificiality late palate into the finish. Some boozy heat lingers.

Bomber came from Adam. Big thanks! White wax which I think is a 2011, poured on 12/14/13. Pours a orange brown, a bit murky, with a small yellowish brown head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, orange peel, some more fruits, figs. Flavor is big time malts, toffee, caramel, lots of fig, some orange peel, still some semblance of hops with a little dankness, and more big malty notes. Lots of flavor, and very much on the sweet side. Mouthfeel is chewy but with plenty of carbonation despite the age. This is good stuff, but I don't think it lives up to its name for me unless it is better fresh.

Serving: 22 oz. bottle via trade with the madbeerbaron. Thanks Ben! 2012 vintage. Pours a muddy brown with a thin tan head. A year old and the hops are still coming through in the nose. Plenty of caramel and dried fruit to go with. Velvety smooth on the tongue with a bit of sweetness up front. Lots of dark caramel, malt, and light bread notes. A hint of fruit and pine on the back end. Lasting finish. A pleasure to drink.

2012 vintage from Justin, thanks a lot!
Pours dark orange with a white head.
Aroma is mostly sweet and caramel malty. Faint hops.
Taste is sweet, caramel malty with some faint hops, herbs and alcohol heat at the end.
Dry mouth feel, low carbonation.
Short bitter after taste.
Quite a let down, nothing really distinct in neither aroma or taste. This is perhaps best when fresh.

2013 Vintage.

Bomber into snifter.

A: Reddish/Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Piney, Bready, Mildly Citrus

T: Piney, Grainy Malts, Bready, Mildly Citrus

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter

Overall, more of a Imperial Red Ale (when its fresh) than a Barleywine.

2013 Bottle thanks to jbickus. I may have opened this a bit late/anti early. The hops have started to fade but are still there. I am usually one to enjoy beer fresh but hadnt gotten around to this one. Pours a ruby brown color with a white foamy head. Aroma of pine and crusty bread. Tastes of honey and dark fruits. For having faded hops, this is still amazing. Hides the alcohol beautifully. Medium to thick bodied with medium carbonation.
Bottle pours amber with nice head, aroma is rich sweet malts, taste is very smooth sweet barley with a nice hop finish

Pours deep, hazy reddish amber with low white head. Aroma of muscovado, resin, butterscotch, light vanilla, hints of citrus. Taste is alcohol and toffee sweet with a long lingering light bitter caramel finish. Creamy, rich body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber with a low tan head. Aroma is caramel, honey, cane sugar, figs, dates. Taste is honey, caramel, figs, dates, hay. Fantastic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 red wax A- pours a milky apple cider brown with a lightly frothy egg shell colored head. Minimal lacing. S- sweet malty grains, cider, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, autumn spices, honey, ginger, mustiness, grass, earth and resin. M- medium tacky body for such a prominent ABV with a medium to full palate. Good carbonation. T- starts slow with some malts, grains and zinc. Overripe apples, ginger, cinnamon, bitter lemon pith, butter and toffee next. Ending is long with dry earth, mustiness, pine resin, coriander, some lemon and bitter grasses. The end sweetens with some molasses and honey as it warms.

2008 vintage, purple wax, at Brandons house, shared 4 ways. Thanks, Ryan. Murky brown with a thin off white head. Deep, big, malty, bright red fruit, alcohol, herbal, caramel. Surprisingly fruity. Much more mellow than and preferable to the 08 Old Crusty that preceded it.
UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 Voodoo barrelroom release bottleshare. Poured darkish orange with light white head. Aroma of barley sweetness. Taste light sour sweet taste. Nice
Amazing aroma. Incredible appearance - dark almond brown color. Love the caramel malts!

A bomber pour a few months back. My favorite barleywine at the time, Sucaba and Angels Share has since taken that top spot. BB is a great sipping barley! What reeled me in sip after sip was the Carmel sweetness! I cant wait for the 14 release.

Bottle, thnx to Bytemesis, drank on my birthday! Yay! Red wax, 2012 vintage. Pours a murky brownish beer with a thin off white head on top. Aroma is incredible, alcoholic, herbal, malty, chocolate and faint hoppyness. Flavour is sweet and complex, lots going on. Very fruity, malty and again a touch of chocolate. Alcohol is present, bit certainly not overwhelming in any way. Awesome brew, very well crafted.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2013 22 oz bottle thanks to JStax. 2013 orange wax bottle. Pours a murky brown-orange color with a small foamy that quickly fades to a ring. Aroma is a great mix of musty citrus hops with sweet malt. Caramel, toffee, grapefruit, oranges, brown sugar, flowers and toasted malt. Taste is moderately sweet with just a light bitterness. Fairly intense, rich caramel, toffee, and brown sugar is countered with citrus and floral hops. Slightly boozy finish but no burn. Medium to thick body with an oily and syrupy mouthfeel. Very smooth sipper. Very good barley wine.

22 ounce bottle into signature tulip glass; Fall 2011 Ohio bottling with yellow wax. Pours slightly cloudy reddish orange color with a 2 finger dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big caramel, grapefruit, orange zest, orange rind, tangerine, toast, toffee, raisin, pear, floral, grass, pine, brown sugar, and floral/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of malt and hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, orange zest, caramel, tangerine, toast, floral, brown sugar, raisin, pear, light pine, grass, and floral/toasted earthiness. Light earthy floral/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, citrus zest, caramel, toast, brown sugar, pear, raisin, floral, light pine, and floral earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome balance and complexity of hop and malt flavors; with a nice bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a creamy, slick, and slightly sticky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent barleywine style. All around great balance and complexity of malt and hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering as expected.

'13 vintage bottle. The pour is a nice carmel hue with a nice thin head. The aroma is a solid blend of booze, malt, and carmel notes. The taste is downright perfect for a barleywine. Slight booziness makes this perfect for a winter night after shoveling the snow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 orange wax bottle from Lemonhead, thanks man!. Dark amber/bronze pour with a finger of creamy looking head. Wonderful aroma of carmel, brown sugar, sweet malts, and a touch of booze. Taste lives up the aroma, sweet up front, bits of carmel, plum, not the big american hoppy barely wine i was expecting. Loved it

2013 orange wax from Belmont. Pours a darker bronze color with a medium khaki head and thick lacing. Big hoppy aroma with sweet malt in there too. Very well balanced flavor between the sweet caramel malt and the spicy green hops. Just a little hint of burn from the 12ABV. Tasty young but I bet this is awesome as it ages. I think there is still a purple wax in the basement...yay for me.
#2800 Red wax. Dark amber/orange with a thin off white head. Floral scent with caramel and pine. Big caramel taste with a nice sharp bitter finish.
Bottle pour into a tulip for this brew. 2013 vintage. Sweet and syrupy but not in a bad way. Very good.

Bomber from 2008, figured it was finally about time to open this up. Deep mahogany with an off white / biege head that leave a nice ring around the glass. Alcohol has become soft and warming, muted and dimmed hops, semi-burnt caramelized malt, sweetish resin. Full body, bittersweet, complex, warming, touch too sweet on the finish but probably because this is 5+ years old. Would love to get some more.

66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Huge thanks!
Thin off white head. Slightly hazy amber pour. Slightly sweet. Awesome brew.
This really reminded me of Averys Hog Heaven. A little too much grapefruit for my taste. I wish it was slightly more balanced.
From the bottle, sweet caramel malts, toffee with a hop bite, definitely get some citrus flavor.  Good stuff!
Red wax,,,,,2012.....shared with SHERM1016....dark amber color with thin head...hoppy nose with caramel and hoppy taste....heavy on the booze and heavy on the hops....very tasty

From a 22 oz bottle shared on the road in South Carolina.  Pours a hazy amber with a massive creamy off white head.  Sweet hoppy aroma.  Flavors of caramel and some grassy hops.  Really nicely put together.  Tasty.
Bottle. Rich amber beer with a cream head. Grapefruit and light pine aroma. Malt and grapefruit flavor with light caramel. Medium bodied. Malt and grapefruit linger with light caramel.

Had this on 01/30/13 at James apt. Thanks to whoever brought. Pour is a "bourbony" dark red-brown with not much head. Aroma is of booze and wood. Flavors of dried dark fruits with notes of brown sugar/molasses. Light- to medium-bodied.

22oz. Bottle. 2013 orange wax.   Pour is a rich mahogany with off white head.  Aroma of caramelized malt and fruity cherry notes.   Flavor is very smooth and balanced.  Cherries, caramel,  with hints of chocolate and brandy.  Dangerously drinkable at 12% abv.

2009 bottle. Pours golden orange with a small white head. The nose is big caramel, citrus, pine and sweet bread. The taste is high sweet and bitter. Perfect balance with age.  The texture is smooth but has some late pop. The body is heavy and the finish is long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour clear amber.  One of pine hop, slight catty, and some caramel malt.  Taste of grapefruit, pine, then malt sweetness,  and alcohol, followed by strong mid palate bitterness and nice long finish.  More hoppy than most barleywines, a nice example.

Barleywines are not my favorite style of beer. Usually, theyre much too sweet and too boozy to really work for me. That said, Behemoth is easily one of the best Ive tried. It is sweet, but not cloyingly so. I dont feel like Im drinking medicine or something. And though I can feel the alcohol, the beer isnt dominated by an underlying hard liquor element. This is a beer I might actually drink again sometime. Pours a rather hazy, brownish-yellow, with minimal, quickly dissipating head. Theres a fruity, hoppy aroma and the flavor is a bitter-sweet combination of malt and hops, with a satisfying mouthfeel and bitter finish. My bottle had orange wax on it (2013?).
Red wax bottle: Cherry, oats, and orange nose approaching that of apricot. Cloudy amber, fine floaties, thick yellow head. Overripe orange, triple sec. Ethereal mouthfeel, but boozy.

2012. Unclear, ruby red. Large, lasting, creamy, frothy white head. Aroma is somewhat muted; a hoppy malty balance. Very nice balance. Big Malty and hoppy. Really very smooth and well put together. Very melded...more so than any other baleywine ive had, and a bit of a pandoras box

aroma of sweet malt and hops.  dark fruit.
MMm.  very smooth and complex.  dark fruit, lace, hops and malt.  earth. spices

best barley wine I have had so far even though the second i have ever had lol sorry guys for the rating but is really a good beer and would get again 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wax is silver with a slughtly green touch i think .. So i huess 2010 ? 
Pours clear , amber coloured , white small foam 
Smell is reminding of german malts . Buttery , creamy 

Taste is caramel , creamy , buttery , sweet , good carbo 

Ok , yet not my thing

2012 vintage (red wax). Copper pour with an off-white head. Sweet caramel, brown sugar, and dark fruits. Nice hoppy aroma of grapefruit, flowers, and pineapple. A fair amount of booze, however. Very nice sweetness and bright hop flavors. Grapefruit, pineapple, and oranges to go with light pine and floral notes. Sweet caramel, brown sugar, and dark fruits. A hint of alcohol on the finish.

Pours a nearly opaque murky amber color with a big, fat head light caramel head. Mild, sweet toffee on the nose. A bit of dried fruit as well. Mouthfeel is smooth and medium-bodied. Almost creamy. A lot of dried fruit in the flavor. A little bit of alcohol and some bitterness at the finish. Decent. Not great.

Bomber. Orange amber color. Lacy off white head. Fruity citrus, and resinny aroma. Some sweet sugar and alcohol in aroma as well. Taste is fruit and caramel sugar, pronounced malt taste. Sweet. Great lasting finish of hops, then malt, then alcohol. Amazing

22oz bottle, orange-ish wax. This is a big beer, no doubt about it. really hoppy nose which is lovely and enjoyable, big chewy sweet body with touches of alcohol but not in a burn way just letting you know its there. Behemoth is a fitting name for this one.

Pours a clear amber/ruby with a huge foamy off white head...nice retention and lacing.  Aroma has boozy notes, citrus hops, and earthy sweet tea.  Flavor has lots of sweetness...caramel and candied fruits...and nice bitterness to cut through...earthy...some tea...resinous.  Mouthfeel is full and silky with an earthy/fruity dry bitter finish that warms...boozy.
Aromatics are strong and hop forward. Lots of citrus. Tastes heavily of malt and caramel. Not super balanced but very nice.

Bottle from Casanovas in Hudson, WI. Big full citrus aromas, pineapple, caramel malt. Very similar taste, has a great caramel/malt finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy reddish-amber with a fluffy white head. Nose is pineapple and citrus. Taste is caramel malt out of the gate with tropical and citrus hop flavors and maybe a touch of pine. Soft and full mouthfeel with a tingly carb. Really wonderful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, white wax. Pours a hazy light copper with some white head. Very sweet, not too boozy. Good caramel,  not much fruit in it.

65 cl bottle @ OHaras Freehouse, Tampere. 2009 vintage.
Originally rated on 20100207.
Pours copper color with a medium head. Aroma of intense hops, resin, pine needles, lots of ripe fruits, sweet caramel malts and some alcohol notes on the background. Flavor of caramel malts, hops, toffee notes, exotic fruits and alcohol. Quite massive brew, excellent.

Pours a reddish orange color with a small head. Nose is absolutely pleasant with hops, and sweet citrus. Taste is sweet and full of citrus, with a predominance of fresh apricots. Ends sweetly with a nice citrus ending. An amazing barley wine. Quaff Score 9 /10

Pours a dark rusty orange with a beige head and sweet fruity aroma of citrus and grapefruit. Taste is of bittersweet, of hops, citrus, grapefruit, caramel, and apricots with a burning, warming, long finish. Great barley wine with a lot of flavor.

Bottle from amazing trade with mwbrady12, drank with teary eye, amazing sweet, rich malt, lots of citrusy hops (especially for a barleywine - the hoppiest barleywine ive had) . My first Three Floyds, thank you again!!

Pours ruby red with minimal head.  Had a lot of character on the nose.  I got grapefruit, cherry, plumb, and grape.  While sweetness is the story, there is a noticable hop bite.  Real thin and light for a barleywine.  This is a good beer, but way overpriced.
Hazy amber with off white head. Smells of sweet pink grapefruit and orange peel. Taste is similar. I like this one.

22oz. Bottle. Pours a beautiful red/amber with minimal white head and decent lacing. Aroma is a mix of grapefruit with cherry. Very sweet. There is something else I cant describe, possibly sparkling grape. Taste is very sweet up front with a pungent, citrus note. There is a  slight hoppy undertone that lingers. Overall a very good beer, but definitely doesnt live up to the hype. Of course my barley wine knowledge is very limited.

Pours a hazy copper with a large mousse like tan head. Aroma of pine and citrus hops. Hints of raisin and plum fruits. Also a slight hint of pear and grapes. Tastes of caramel malt, but very hop forward that gives citrus and pine hop flavors that linger long into the finish. Hop bitter finish, though there is an initial sweetness. Full bodied with a strong, though not overpowering alcohol warming. Medium carbonation. Delicious beer.

22 ounce bottle, orange wax sealed for the 2012-2013 season, shared and sampled among 5 people. Big pine aroma, bitter hop scents jump out of the glass upon pouring it out. Appearance is a bright orange with sparkling carbonation and a good head of white foam on top. The appearance of the label art is eye catching too. Is that...barrel seed splurging out from the labels top right graphic? Taste is a fully blown palate sizzler comprised of pine, orange, grapefruit, cookies, and a touch of malted liquor sweetness. Palate is medium bodied, bubbly, and big enough to draw out the flavor dynamic. Overall, this one probably could have used some aging, although Ive heard that Behemoth is best consumed soon after being brewed. While this is an excellent beer, I couldnt help but think that the flavors just werent ripe enough yet, and without any aging it was greener, harsher, and boozier than it would be under better conditioning.
Aroma is piney hops and a big hint of malt sweetness.  The flavor is grapefruit, dryish/sweet malts, underlying hints of fruit and a very warming alcoholic finish.
Aroma of great citrus hops: grapefruit and orange zest and slight grass.  Very intense nose.  Taste is great with pine hop, citrus, and a cane sugar underneath.  Fantastic and hoppy.

Purchased at the source recently, Feb. 2013. Pours a cloudy orangish brown with a nice white head that dissipates quickly. Leaves lots of lacing. Slight, Three Floyd's signature hop (onion) aroma. Pallet is thick and hearty. Taste is sweet , but not too sweet, sugary malt and hops. I love thick, slightly sweet beers and this one is excellent. First barley wine I have had. Liking the style after drinking this one. Will certainly buy again. A real treat......

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy deep amber liquid with small to medium off-white head. Aroma of pine, toffee, coconut, light caramel, toast, light citrus and light portish oxidisation. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with notes of resin, toffee and light oxidisation. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Great stuff.
Hoppy hoppy stuff.  Really hoppy for a BW. Hop aroma. Spicy hops. Sweet candy taste.  One of the best barleys.
Mastery of the style rich heavy bitter barley wine almost like a triple IPA but even more intense

Hearty, full body. Good caramel malt, and conditioning. I loved this beer! I could taste the mango and orange flavors, my favorite fruits!! First time rating a beer, Ill I can say is wow!! Cant wait to try all of three Floyds variety

Big sweet malt aroma with notes of pine, fruit and orange. Flavor is initially very sweet with a big malt character that finishes with a dry bitterness and a dark fruit note.  Mouthfeel is full carbonation is average.  Overall a delicious beer.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2013 [2013 vintage]Massive beer! S: Huge fresh, pungent, resinous hop presence - big resinous pine, orange peel and mango fruits. Through the overwhelming hops there are lots of rich, sweet caramel malts. A: Pours a dirty blonde and sits a dirty, clear ruby with a sticky creamy beige cream head. T: Incredibly sweet hops and malt - big citrus fruits and caramel. Itâs on the verge of being cloyingly sweet but balanced by a notable tartness. P: Full and sticky, and lingers like no other. Mouth feels coated in wax. O: Absolutely fantastic. A huge beer with tons to offer. Have another sitting in the cellar, cannot wait to see how it ages! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPone

Poured into snifter at brew pub. Smell of sweet malt, caramel, toffee and slight hints of vanilla. Pours a deep, cloudy reddish/brown. Beers coats the tongue with flavors similar to the smell but also with a bit of raisin/plum. Also has some sweet booziness at the tail end. One of the best barley wines for sure.

Great hoppiness with this barley wine balanced with an excellent sweetness.  Enough hops to make me happy!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 22oz.
Pours deep amber with very low white head. Aroma is of malt, sweetness, some fruits. Taste is of malt, lots of sweet, sligth candy juice. Palate: Full bodied. Overall: A good Barleywine. Nothing to break your arse on the ceiling.

65 cl bottle vintage 2009 @ OHaras Freehouse. Rated on 08.02.2010
Aroma is rather hoppy with lots of exotic fruits, some caramel and biscuits. Flavour is also rather hoppy with lots of fruits, some caramel, biscuits, raisins and distant herbal notes. One of the best barley wines Ive had  quite close to a DIPA actually.

65 cl bottle vintage 2009 @ Beer Hunters, Pori. Rated on 02.06.2012
This one has turned from DIPA into a barley wine. A real caramel overdose on aroma and flavour. I liked it more fresh, harsh score estimate: 3.8.

Last bottle from 08 trip to FFF in Munster.  Shared with Nate.  Pours amber red with orange hues, egg shell/off white, fluffy, rocky, pillowy head.  Great lacing.  Peppery, caramel nose, brown sugar.  Classic barley wine.  Well balanced malt with an abundance of bitter lingering.  Mild hop flavor, but you can tell it was there.  Some fruity notes, slight lemon, orange, cherry, grapefruit.

Bottle (22 oz). Traded by totoropanda, thanks! Clear amber with a small white head. Aroma of malt, alcohol, pine, caramel and hops. Taste is about the same with alcohol and malt being even more present. Heavily sweet, but the strong alcohol is doing a good job keeping the balance despite the fact that the hops have faded. Lots of warming alcohol. Heavy and harsh body. Its a good Barley Wine, but it doesnt have the same level of complexity than the best of the style.

Bottle. Clear copper gold pour with white head. Meaty, malty aroma, strong whiffs of alcohol, hops, caramel. Taste is malty, biscuity, caramel, light menthol, good finishing bitterness. Rich creamy palate, nice alcohol warmth, maybe the strong point of this beer.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2013 Bomber. Red wax. 2012 vintage. Thanks to mike12da. Huge hop and caramel nose  -- the maltiness grows on each approach. Dark honey, with a creamy tan head. Massive malt on first sip; perfect balance in mid, with some stewed peaches and pie; finishes in balanced fashion, with some lingering bitterness and chocolate notes. Medium-heavy body. A great one!

Bomber. Nose of sweet oranges, peaches, esters, citrus hops, tobacco. Glowing orange color, lightly cloudy, with lace. Huge depth of fruits in the flavors: citrus, mandarins, dry tropical, peach, melon, mango. Coomplex, drinkable, delicious.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2013 White wax bottle. Has been in a temp controlled cellar since we got it through trade. Pours vibrant orange with a small, very firm white cap on top. Nose shows hop resin, loads of passionfruit and tropical fruit notes, and some deeper, darker fruits underneath. A touch of orange and toffee in there too. Taste showcases the fruits fantastically. Heavy caramel biscuit with more hop resin. Sweet passionfruit and mango are lasting. Slick and full mouth feel. Canât taste the booze at all. Dangerously easy drinking stuff. Unbelievable beer

Red Wax. Pours amber with a nice eggshell head.  Smell of sweet malt and citrus.  Basically pineapple.  The taste is sweet malt, and a slightly bitter citrus hop finish with a hint of alcohol.  Delicious.
2011 Bottle with Chris and Ray. Pours murky amber with tan head.  Notes of honey, caramel malts, dark fruits and oak.  Some decent hop flavor for a barley wine.

Red Wax.  It poured a caramel color with a small white head. The aroma was lots of citrus, floral hops and some caramel. The taste was more of the same with strong hop bitterness and a great rich malt balance. A different type of Barley Wine, very good.

Three Floyds does it again.  I was a bit reticent to try this again, as in the past Ive footed the 20$ bill only to have regret fill my belly instead of deliciousness.  Maybe my tastes have improved, maybe Im caught off guard, but holy mackerel!  This beer is aptly titled.  It fills the mouth and even seems to coat it for that matter, all while leaving a thicken saliva (dont know how else to describe it).  It is nice.  The smell is sweet caramel.  The taste is sweet caramel.  This is very balanced, although I would prefer a little more hop flavoring (only because I am a complete HopHead).  Overall this is a tongue pleaser, not just a belly and "drunkness" pleaser.  If youve got the money, you wont regret it.   If you dont, dont sweat it, not all of us are dumb enough to spend all their extra monies on beer.

Bottle at home, all for myself. 2011 Vintage. Pour is hazy amber with a medium sized, off-white head and great lacing. Big hoppy aroma on the front end with notes of grapefruit, citrus, and orange. Much maltier on the backend with notes of caramel, figs, bread, brown sugar, and light alcohol. Big sweet juicy citrus upfront, grapefruit, orange juice, tangerines, and pineapple, lead into a very smooth middle with notes of raisins, caramel, toffee, and biscuit, ending with a medium bitter/hoppy finish. Creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Smooth, yet hoppy, sweet, but well-balanced with not a hint of alcohol in sight. Juicy and delicious. Really tasty stuff. Well-done!

From bottle, courtesy of dpjuart. Big raisin nose, musty malt with brown sugar and caramel. Buckwheat honey and light grassy hops. Sweet alcohol and macerated plums. Tobacco. Dark golden coppery clear with foamy lacing beige head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Starts sweet and malty with tons of raisin, plum, tobacco, honey, and light roasted malts. Light rubbery hops with mild oxidation. Tasty barley wine, complex though subtle. Smooth, sweet after.

Not of my liking.  Has a very strong aftertaste. Would not get it again.  Then again, I am not a fan of barleywine

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had on draft at FFF Brewpub. Served in a snifter.

A: Pours a clear mahogany with dark amber hues around the edges where the light hits it. One finger, off-white head forms on the pour and leaves some great lacing on the way down.

S: Im picking up some tropical fruits and some candied sugars. Very sweet. There is a slight sweet toffee malt as well floating in the background.

T: Sweet sugars up front with a light caramel malt backbone. The hops pop back up again, but this time they give a little bit of bitterness to counter the sweetness. There is a little alcohol presence on the finish with a slight warming on the way down. This definitely tastes more like a huge DIPA with more malt.

M: Feels creamy on the way in and leaves with a dryness that brings you back for more. The bitter hops leave a slight profile on the tongue and the carbonation is nice.

O: This is very hopped up and very sweet, but it is still good and I enjoyed it a lot more than I remember.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 09-11-2011

Pours a cloudy amber color, not at all what I was expecting. Aroma is citric hops, some light toffee notes. This is, in fact, an imperial ipa. Not much barleywine characteristics going on here. If I tasted this blind, I would say dipa all the way. That being said, its really good. Very hoppy, spicy with a strong malt backbone. Good carbonation. This is solid stuff.

A-- Poured a light, clear orange brown color. Looks quite thin for a barleywine. Really nice two finger light brown head. Great body to the head before finally falling to film. Good retention to this as well.

S-- Toffee, orange, grapefruit, pine, and bread. Can tell in smell that the hops have fallen off and the malt is taking over. Alcohol is very well hidden in the nose. 

T-- Orange, toffee and bread. Slightly sweet taste and really the last bit that the hops have any impact as still get citrus here and there in the taste. 

M-- Slick and sweet. Very full bodied but not coying in the least. Well hidden ABV in the feel as well. Very, very solid. Get slight notes of strawberry with the orange. Lower medium carbonation.

O-- Has to be a hop bomb fresh. Get remnants of the hops but it adds a lot to the beer at this point in time. Scary easy to drink as could drink a bomber of this very quickly.

09 bottle
Amber, small dense white head.  Aroma is a bit buttery, caramel, malt.  Taste is sweet dark fruit, hint of hops.  Low carbonation.  Good barleywine, wish it was thicker, sweeter.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2013 Red wax. Pours deep orange with a huge thick head and beautiful lacing. The nose is sweet malts and fruity hops. The taste is bitter hops and toasted sweet malt. Very sweet and hoppy.

2012 red wax. Thanks to the gross bastard. Still some heat in this, especially in the finish. Pretty easy-drinking, lots of caramel and sweet malts but not overly sweet. Low hop aroma to speak of, rather flat nose here. Fairly dry, I can see this beer going great with the various barrel treatments.

I received a 2011 vintage (yellow wax) in a trade with a friend from Ohio (thanks, Max!). I poured it into a tulip glass.

Appearance: Honey/caramel hue; opaque body; forms a large, dark khaki, frothy head which leaves gorgeous lacing on the glass. 

Smell: Very herbal nose with confectionary sweetness and distinct pine hops. No alcohol presence.

Taste: The barleywine style tends to be a bit of a double-edged sword. Great taste but low drinkability. That was my expectation going into Three Floyds Behemoth Barleywine (I mean its right there in the name). But one sip into it and I realized this wasnt a beast after all. Much like the nose and appearance, the palate begins with a light tea-like sweetness. Ive encountered this flavor in lighter beers before, but never in a barleywine.

 Sweet, syrup-tasting flavors of caramel and toffee become very predominant through the middle. But riding shotgun throughout the entire palate is a distinct piney hop bitterness. Strong enough to let you know its there, but not to the point where this could be considered an imperial IPA. Its much more of a sweet beer than it is bitter, but the inclusion of the hops without going overboard is pretty amazing. The absolute lack of alcohol is quite impressive as well. Mostly I enjoy the iced tea-like flavor throughout the entire swig. A delicious beer to say the least and unlike any other American barleywine Ive ever had - and the best to date, by the way.

Drinkability: With a name like "Behemoth Barleywine" you go into this beer with an expectation of booziness and unbridled energy. The fact this beer is not only drinkable, but highly so, is nothing short of amazing. At 10.5% ABV theres definitely some warmth to the palate, but nothing ridiculous. The aftertaste is an interesting mix of piney hops and candy sweetness. Slightly dry, slightly sweet, but never annoying. I was able to drink the entire 22oz bottle myself (outside on a hot summer afternoon I might add) no problem. Theres no reason to be intimidated by this one.

2010 vintage

A: The label art is outrageous and awesome, as is typical of any FFF beer. The beer appears mostly clear and is dark orange in color. The head is off-white and leaves a good amount of lacing upon the glass.

S: The aroma is potent and easily detected from a few feet away, with scents of hops, pine / pine resin, alcohol.

T: Behemoth is very hop forward, with a heavy alcohol and pine resin presence. The alcohol content is subdued to a certain degree by the huge hop aroma. Though the beer possesses a healthy malt bill, this barleywine is more hop forward than many other examples of the style.

M: The feel is medium-bodied with a lingering sticky pine aftertaste.

D: Best enjoyed in small quantities, this is a great bottle to share a few ways.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-17-2010

Bottle Red Wax: Poured a burnt orange coppery color with a soft thin off white light tan head. Aroma has a strong sticky caramel that stuck  to the inner nose. Taste is a mix of burnt caramel malt and nice gritty strong citrus hops character, nice sticky fruit finish on the palate. This was a long time in the making since my original 2010 bottle broke in my check bag on a return trip to Italy from Florida. My sons godfather had visited the brewery and had brought it to me, what a same. It was worth the wait I must say!

Extremely well balanced. Perfect balance of hop and classic barley wine flavors. Not overpowering on any front. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

CBC.
Tap, 110512.
Amber with white head. Aroma of caramel and malt. Flavour with fruit, alcohol note and spices.

Bottle - 2011 (Red Wax). Thanks Randy! Pours clear amber with a small off-white head and minimal lacing. Aroma is citrus, a bit of caramel malt. Taste is citrus orange/grapefruit, caramelish roasted malt, notes of pine and just a bit of sweetness. Finish is somewhat bitter. Alcohol is very well masked in this beer. Reminded me as much as anything a warmer more alcoholic Sierra Pale Ale (bottle, not tap). Very interesting, but i am thinking to let my other bottle age for 4-5 years to see how it evolves.

Reddish amber color, clear. Strong citrus hops aroma, like a pale ale. Nice blend of light malt, bright citrus fruit, and a mild bitter finish. Hard to detect the alcohol which is incredible for a 10+ abv beer. A+++.

From the bottle with a green-wax 2010 release, pours a deep amber with a nice off-white foamy head, very nice lacing.  Smells strongly like a typical barley wine while pouring. Once in the glass, aromas of malts and alcohol, some caramel, rather sweet.  Taste is quite complex.  Dull at first sip, crescendoing to a sweetness, and mellowing into a bitterly hoppy finish.  Notes of caramel malts and alcohol, citrusy hoppy, smooth to start and rough to finish.  Clearly, more care is put into brewing this beer than the cover girl puts into her appearance.  Thumbs up.

Bottle thanks to someone. Dark amber pour with a decent white head. Nice lace. Sweet aroma of caramel, candied hops, fruit and resin.  Nice caramel flavor up front with a nice hoppy back end. Long lingering bitter finish.  About as classic as a big hoppy barley wine goes.  Top notch indeed.
Little head, golden, Strong and tight nose with concentrated hops. Medium body and length. Taste is strong, heavy and lightly hoppy with grapefruit and hay. Very heavy and almosst unballanced.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. This is a blurry woody brown beer with a big lasting and lacing off-white head. Great sweet aroma. Its really fruity with concentrated caramel and sticky raisins. Really nice indeed. It has a average carbonation level and a kinda sticky texture. Flavors are just like a classic barley wine should taste; Sweet sticky caramel, some flowers and melon. Really tasty! A true classic barley! 12.05.2012

Draught @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012
Pours clear deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, alcohol, citrus, grape and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long malty, alcohol and bitter finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Sampled at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Pours a clear and copper beer with a weak offwhite head. The aroma is malt, caramel and fruit. The flavor follows the nose with additional alcohol. The palate is sweetness with alcoholwarmth. Overall a really good beer. [Rating #3300]

2008 purple wax bottle drank in 2010. Poured a cloudy ruby shade with medium head and impressive lacing. Aromas of pineapple, mango, pine, bourbon, licorice, tons of caramel malts, and some other bready scents. Taste is delicious, a nice blend of booze, tropical fruits, and raisins. One of the easiest drinking, lighter bodied barleys you can get. Very solid.

Bottle shared at local tasting a while back now, pours a clear golden/orange with a thin white head, the aroma has a strong amount of hops with some booze and spices, the flavor has a good amount of hops on the front end with a smooth finish with a touch of booze in the finish, very easy drinking, delicious.

Rich amber/copper color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, toffee, spicy hops, & fruit; Flavor of woody sweet malt, spicy hops, caramel/toffee, molasses, and rich fruit; Slight alcohol at the finish; Nicely balanced; Overall, somewhat mellow - but still delicious.

Tap at CBC, May 2012. It pours orange-amber, with a thick off-white head. The nose is spice, honey, hot cross bun, sweet fruit, grass and pine. The taste is wood, leather, lemon pith, varnish, grass, resin, golden syrup, booze, spice, grass and hot cross buns, with a long, warming-bitter finish. Full body and moderate carbonation. Overall a good hoppy barley wine, which I think I would prefer with a few years on it.

Poured from bomber to snifter, big thanks to mordormongo for this!

Blonde? Maybe a real dirty blonde. Pours a bright amber - pretty much exactly the color of the amber that the mosquito was preserved in from the first Jurassic Park movie. Nice finger of silky off-white head that fades out to a thick collar with some spotty bits retaining in the middle. Very nice to look at.

Smells massive... boozy resinous hops, caramel, butterSCOTCH... I could keep my nostrils shoved down in there for a good while, and even as it sits in front of me on the table I can smell how pungent it is.

Definitely a substantial hop presence... hops, then some malty bits, then a booze burn that dries things up. In my mind, the taste of this thing borders a big old IIPA. Enough hops to satisfy a non-barleywine drinker I think.

The feel is rather low as the booze is really pretty harsh. I dont mind that one bit myself but it does affect drinkability.

Extremely pleased with this one. Thanks very much Scott!

2011 bottle (White wax). Pours a slightly hazy golden color with slight white head. Aroma is of slight hop, grass, fruit and malty and spice. Similar to an old DIPA with spice. Taste is again very similar to a faded DIPA. Some fruit, pepper, spice and hay. Overall, didnt stand out to me for the style.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: 100ml draught at the first day of CBC 12. Clear, red-brown coloured body, decent off-white head. Herbal hops and dried fruity smell. Malt-fruity flavour including ingredients like apricot, pine, herbs, and caramel sweetness beneath.  Bittersweet finish. Very nice, however, rather heavy to drink (Copenhagen, 11.05.2012).

Tap @ CBC. Deep amber orange color with a tiny white head. The nose is sweet malty peaches and pineapple. Theres definitely a nice hop presence though. Bouncy malts. The taste is peach juice and strawberry, some caramel and hoppy cheese. Like a very malt-forward IIPA. A bit hot and astringent. Full bodied, prickly carbonation. Overall, very nice.

CBC. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, alcohol and rather hoppy - fruity. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. 110512
Resiny and piney. Rye on the nose. Very hoppy and malt. Caramel backbone. Smooth and silky finish.
2Nd best barley wine Ive ever had. Cant go wrong with the Floyd. Like drinking a noir when I love merlot. Flavors there, just a little more mellow.

Draught at CBC. Slightly hazy orange, off white head. Aroma of caramel, herbs, peach, grapefruit & citrus. Taste is well balanced bitter & sweet, huge boozy body yet extremely fresh mouthfeel, guess it is the generous amounts of hops. Had one of theese, then one more - and one more. A thirst-quenching barley wine!

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2012 tap at cbc - pours clear amber golden - off-white head with yellowish hints. Aroma of peach, grapefruit & citrus. Massive body, bitter & sweet in a quasi perfect balance. 
Re-rated 15/06/2012 - bottle vintage 2008. Conserved really well. Aroma is more caramel and more complex exotic fruits (pineapple). More sweet than bitter, but still pretty kicking in at the end. Very smooth and mellow. Wauw

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Another American classic passed me by for too long, now finally in my glass. :-) Clear deep orange body, big off-white head. Very nice looking indeed. Aroma is caramel, grassy hops, hints of melon and fresh herbs. Very hoppy, even for an American BW. Taste is melon, grass, pine, caramel, hints of syrupy (DIPA-like) hop tones and bitter herbs. Seems a bit fresh to me. Medium carbonation, rather smooth body. Nice, but vastly overrated IMO.

2012 bottle with red wax. Pours copper color with a whitish head. Aromas are citrus and floral with a hint of malt. Classic American BW aroma. Tastes are big hops with floral and citrus and pine. Also caramel maltiness and a hint of vanilla. delicious all around.  Another classic from FFF.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Pours dark golden with a creamy offwhite head, leaving nice lacings. Aroma of sweet roasty malt, caramel, citrusly hoppy, grapefruit, pine. Taste is sweet malty, caramel, light vanilla, lots of fruity hops, peach, apricot, grapefruit, pine. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, alcohol well hidden.110512

Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Golden amber with a decent white head that leaves behind some lacing. Aroma is hoppy - pine, apricot, grapefruit. More balanced on the palate than the aroma implies, sweet with a touch of bitter in the aftertaste. Taste is orange marmalade, apricot, peach, pineapple and a touch of resin. Not bad but I prefer my barley wines to weigh a little more on the sweet side.

Deep golden, close to burgundy.slightly off white head clinging to the glass. Relatively clear. 
Aroma is hoppy floral notes, dates, raisins. Nice. Sweet..
Taste is hoppy at first, but very balanced. Great balance for such a big beer. Malty sweetness comes through briefly, but is fast subdued by the hops. Finish is slightly bitter. Wow what a superbly balanced brew. Body is medium to full and slightly oily. Perfect carbonation in my opinion. Very drinkable for beeing so strong.
07 bottle shared with my buds Mike and Phil. Still a good amount of malt presence in this one but not that sweet. Hops are still alive and well. Drinking very well.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2014 Draught @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012.
Pours a copper amber colour with a small lacy head. Aroma of caramel malts, English toffee, strong floral hops and some citrus. Flavour of strong caramel malts, floral hops, toffee, citrus and orange zest. Full bodied, slick mouthfeel and a big warming, crispy, floral finish. Extremely good drinkability for a 12% abv beer. 8-4-8-4-16 4.0

650 ml bottle, fresh 2014 version. Pours a dark amber orange colour. Fresh herbal aroma with strong grapefruit. Very fresh, floral hoppy, caramel flavour. Strong resiny notes with sweet peach fruitiness. Alcohol is very well hidden. Juicy, rich and complex. Brilliant.

2009 vintage shared at Mikkeller bar.  Clear amber pour with an off white head.  Aroma of bread and caramel.  Flavour of sweet malts, toffee and sweet fruits.  Full bodied with low carbonation.  Fantastic!
