2008 bottle, thanks! Poured deep orange/amber with thin white lace, aroma is full of citrus and a blast of caramel sweet malt.  Taste up front has its hop character subdued, but there is enough left where it perfectly balanced the malt.  Tasty and great barleywine!

On tap at the Trion.
  A very impressive beer.  Im not often much for a barleywine, but the wonderful aroma and smooth, creamy sweet taste really made for a great experience.  I look forward to going back for another pint!

22 oz. bomber from 2009 courtesy of agl108.  Pours a hazy amber with a thick antique-white head.  Loads of grapefruits and pine in the resiny aroma.  Some red apples, pears, overly ripe peaches, caramel, molasses, golden raisins, and vanilla extract present too.  Goes down full-bodied and just a touch sticky.  Lots of sweet, kinda cloying, caramel and molasses start things off flavor-wise.  This is followed by plums, the overly ripe peaches, some vanilla, and rye.  Tons of grapefruits and orange peels finish things off.  Some warming alcohol is present throughout.  Good, but I expected more.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2010 Bottle, vintage 2009. A hazy medium amber beer with a large, frothy, lacing, mstly diminishing off white head. The aroma is moderately malty and moderately to heavily hoppy. There are notes of toasted grains, caramel, grapefruit, pine needles, resin, apricot, peach, sugar and alcohol. The flavour is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately sour, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, very long finish with moderate to heavy bitterness, moderately alcoholic, lightly syrupy, lightly sticky. Quite well balanced in both nose and mouth, not excessively alcoholic and abrasive, but a bit sticky and  syrupy. Anyway a very nice beer, something between a classic Barley Wine and an IIPA.

22 oz. bomber, 2009 bottle release.  Poured hazy, deep orange with barely any head but left fine sheets of lace.  Fairly subdued sweet nose.  BIG caramel sweetness starts this one off.  Then progresses towards a resiny, citrusy, bitter finish.  Some dark fruits, plums, raisins present as well.  Just a tinge of alcohol burn that became more evident as it warmed.  This one was obviously young, and behaved that way.  Would be interesting to see how this one evolves.

(Bottled, 2009 vintage) Slightly hazy reddish amber with a small head. Aroma has lots of grainy malt, exotic-fruity hops. Reminds me quite a lot of NBE. Flavor is very hoppy, exotic-fruity, grainy-malty, but more like a double IPA than barley wine. Medium to full body, thinner than expected. Yes, its a good beer - but at least this young its not quite a classic. 7-7-3-7

Purple wax - 2008. Pours amber with a beige head. Aroma is heavy malt, caramel, plum, raisin, and hop (citrus, peach and pine), Flavour is caramel, plum, raisin, and hoppy, citrus and peach. Bitter. Well balanced.

22oz Bomber. A hazy glowing orange golden color with a foamy thick head. Perfumy aroma with a huge floral and bubblegum aroma. Slick and oily soft body with a bubblegum lingering finish. Hops are abundant yet not overpowering or bitter. Delicious flavor that is decadent and sweet. Slight bitter finish. Fruity flavors are enjoyable and make for a desert like treat. Certainly better then the Dreadnaught I had last night.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Bottle. 2009 edition.  Pours out in a deep amber colour with a low off-white head. Rich and dense aroma of resin, loads of tropical fruits, red cherries, over-riped red grapefruit and alcohol. Full-bodied with notes of cherries, raisins, resin, caramel, fudge and red grapefruit. Smooth, almost sticky mouthfeel. Long chewy and warming finish of resin, red cherries, figs, pine, caramel and mild alcohol. Really tasty if a bit young.

Bottle (bomber), thanks to mybestfriend for the purchase. Deep amber with a creamy off-white head. Intense malty and bisquity aroma with floral hops and tropical fruits. Medium bodied and very smooth. Very well balanced. The best Barley Wine Ive had so far.

On tap, and large snifter served at Brixies in Brookfield, IL. Poured a brownish amber with a little ruby tone showing through. The head was modest, off white foam that reduced rather quickly to a small ring and film, leaving some streaks of lacing. The aroma was citrus as ruby-grapefruit and orange, strong resin, a touch of litter box to get my attention, rich malt and mid-fruit sweetness, and the presence of alcohol. The flavor followed this profile quite well, and added a strong but supportive amount of hop bitterness, and then, warming alcohol. A top notch Barleywine!
BIG taste on this one. Nice balance of hops, malt and alcohol sweetness. Pours out of the bottle a golden brown with a thin white head. Hands down the best barleywine Ive ever had.

2008 version. A dark amber barley wine with a thin off whit ehead. Smooth caramel malt in aroma, with light c-hops, very nice and subdued, vinous. In mouth, a smooth barley wine with light oxidation, biscuitty malt, very nice subdued c-hops, clean and blended.  Tasted Dec. 19 2009.

2008 bottle thanks to HogTownHarry. Yay: Appearance: Rusty brown, small off white head. Aroma: Smells like happy. Raisins, happiness, lovely bitterness running through it, caramel, cherry, lots of hops bubbling to come through. Delicious. Flavour: Caramel mixed with hops and liquorice, delicious winter fruitiness to it, lots of roastiness, coffee and treacle, a cheeky amount of alcohol hiding in the background, lovely long sweet winter fruit finish. Delicious.

Bottle shared at a Portland BA/RB tasting held at Baileys Taproom...  [2007 release] Poured amber with a khaki head.  Ginger-like notes, apples, brandy-ish alcohol, fruits which lent to dark sugars.  Lightly spiced with an off soda quality.  Also some apparent hops still.

22oz bottle that was pretty expensive to me at $15. Poured this into a snifter. The color was dark ruby red with a decent off-white head. The smell was sweet, a little hoppy with caramel notes. The taste was amazing. Citrus, caramel, pine, syrup. This was like nectar! This may be the best barleywine I have ever had just barely beating the Old Ruffian on cask. Alcohol was well masked but the mouthfeel had a little astringency. Not an every day beer but for my birthday it was perfect.

1/13/08 2007 vintage was not as good as it was fresh (see above) syrupy and still had a nice fruitiness but makes me wonder about how this beer will do with age....

05/01/08 2007 vintage delicious, thick, syrupy, delicious this will age well and should be shared to mitigate how hardcore it is.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-16-2007 16:27:48

2008 bottle, sampled Jan. 2010:  This one pours a clear, amber color.  There was a couple of fingers of a beige head on mine that dropped away rather quickly.  Lots of pine to the nose.  Still, an overall sweetness comes to the top.  Also fruits (pear), caramel malts and a touch of alcohol.  Oooohhh, this is smooth.  A nice balance of the bitterness and sweetness.  It is a touch sweet to the finish.  Caramel, and some pine flavors.  Some fruits in there, but in the background.  Fairly full bodied.  This is really excellent!

(Sample Date: 7/18/2009   Source:Other)   At Immys RB Bash. Citrus floral hop aroma over lots of caramelized sugars. Clear dark amber golden with small white head. Huge hop presencecitrus floral. Moderate caramel maltiness to back. Finish is medium sweet with hefty residual bitterness. Medium body and mouth.

750ml bottle from Drinks over Dearborn, in Chicago. Pours a hazy golden color with offwhite head and foamy lacing. Beautiful aroma of citrus and ripe appricot. Nice flavor, balance of sweet dried fruit and slight bitter. Traces of spice and ripe fruit. Nice lingering sweetness and dryness.

22oz bottle from Whole Foods Market in Chicago. Light copper color offwhite head with slight lacing. Strong malty sweet aroma, dried fruit candy and toffee. Nice carbonation, noticeable alcohol, though not overpowering. Malty sweet flavor, balanced with hoppy bitter; traces of citrusy oranges and toffee. Bala aftertaste lingers on the tongue alcohol not overpowering.
Bottle. Dark golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is apple, alcohol, licorice, resin. Flavour is alcohol, hop, licorice, apple, resin, malt. Full bodied nice beer.
65 cl bottle, Winnipeg, MB, Canada via Chicago. Slightly hazy copper colour, dough and cinnamon spiced floral aroma. Thick and syrupy in the mouth, sweet with raisins and alcohol on the finish.

Blue wax.  New Years Eve!  Grapefruit, resin, toffee, caramel and orange peel in the aroma.  Reddish-copper color with a khacki head and a flimsy layer staying on top the whole way through.  Nice scattered spotty lacing.  Rich caramel malty flavor thats perfectly balanced with equal parts resin hops and a healthy dose of citrus.  Its a bit sweet but kept in check and actually complimented quite well by the bitter hops.  Very tasty and an awesome example of what an American Barleywine should taste like.

2009 vintage.  Thin whitish cover over a clear dark red body.  Aroma is caramel, toffee, dried fruits, raisins, apples, alcohol.  Taste is sweet, raisins, apricots, apples, caramel, thick malty sweetness.  Solid stuff.

On tap at Three Floyds on 7/21/09.  Pours gold with beautiful frothy eggshell head.  Super citrusy hops aroma with a touch of caramel.  Nice sweetness up front followed by a solid bitterness.  Medium body with okay carb.  Good bitter finish with a little touch of caramel on the tongue.  Incredible american barley wine.

Yellow wax, vintage 2006 released 2007, 3 years oldHazy dark amber color; small, persistent creamy head. Huge caramel, malt and hop aroma, light Bourbon vanilla too, nuts, light sweat, and light raisins. Good body strength, full malt flavor, caramel, sweet but not syrupy, sweet nuts too; strong bitterness, resiny and a bit fruity, with raisins; its actually less aggressive than modern American samples, and closer to my beloved Thomas Hardys Ale. The alcohol just creates a warming feeling in the end. Powerful and yet well balanced.

Bottle, 22oz. Its an almost clear, golden beer with an off-white head. Resiny, grapefruity nose with malts in the background. Fluorine, beefstock and some roasted hints as well. Pretty much the same in the mouth, but slighlty more pronounced, and with a wonderful bitterness. Bitter, sweet and malty finish. Full-bodied and slighlty warming. A really lovely beer, maybe a tad on the sweet side though. 090828
bottle. brown sugar, dark fruit, dates/figs, spicy hops, alcohol, syrupy. very complex. wow im getting drunk. i love three floyds.
Hazy amber with beige head. Aroma is sweet with raisins, brown sugar and dates. Sweet, sugary flavour with raisins and dates. Im loving it...

I also think Uncle Steve procurred this for the guys.  Shared with the Celticbrw himself, the Undaunting DrBayern, and Brian the Beer Pimp.
Hoppy aroma.  Pours dark copper color, with a head that lasts and holds nicely to the glass.  The flavor is an easy hop flavoring .  Easy to drink!

yellow wax bottle. pours dark copper with a thin head. aroma is sweet with caramel and malt. mouthful is a big malty bomb with some caramel and sweetness. little bit of citrus and hops come around for the finish. great for the style.

Sampled at Darkness Day and I forget which vintage...damn me...Anyways, pours a hazy red brown with little head.  Aroma is very well balanced of citrus hops, caramel malts, and small sweet notes of alcohol.  Flavor is bitter sweet.  Palate is smooth, thick and lush...very solid beer.  Barley wines are hit or miss and this definitely hits.

650 ml bottle. A reddish amber body with a fine off-white head. Aroma of heavy malt and lots of floral hops. Flavor is sweet malt, caramel, dry fruit some alcohol and quite bitter. Its complex and very balanced, lots of everything but nothing to overwhelming. Full body with a long, sweet and bitter finish, both citric and floral bitterness. Really nice.

bottle, 2007 vintage courtesy of Ughsmash, pours light brown with a medium tan head.  Aroma is brown sugar and grapefruit and citrus hop notes.  Flavor is nice and sweet with toasted malts, candy sugar and yeast and just a faint remnance of hops leaving a light bitterness.  Nice and creamy, a great sipping beer.

2009 bottle picked up at DLD 09.  Clear pumpkin/amber colored pour, almost no carbonation and a very rich malt, flowers and alcohol aroma.  Flavor is syrupy caramelly malts, muddled herbs, and finished with lingering booze and hops.  Barley Wines are generally hit or miss with me, but I really liked this one.

Tasted 2009-11-29. 2008 bottle. After having been on a little beer hiatus, I found this one sitting alone in the fridge. We thought: "yeah, why not", and took it out to warm up a bit. It ended the hiatus; That fat bitch on the label is one tasty mama... It poured quite hazy and had very well rounded notes of malt, spices and even some hops after all this time. Now to revisit the cellar to see what other jewels I forgot I had. (If Im not mistaken theres a case of Westy 12 down there partying with their good friend Lou Pepe.)
Poured medium amber, simple, caramel, alcohol, disapated citrus hops, little malty.

I believe this was compliments of Stevey, anyways, it poured an orange/amber hue, formed small off beige head of foam.  Aroma was more pungent of hops, pine resins and malt.  The flavour was that of an Imperial IPA, much smoother than most BW beers, hops and malty caramel goodness balance this beer, making abv well hidden, thus dangerous.  Most excellent beer.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle 650ml. @ LCRBM09 - Low Countries RateBeer Meeting V, Kulminator, Antwerpen, Belgium.Light unclear medium to dark orange amber color with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, citrus - orange peel, light to moderate yeasty, alcohol. Flavor is heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090905]

2009, blue wax edition: Amber, orange colored brew. Aroma is exotic fruits, orange, some citric, floral hops. Flavor is hoppy, citric, floral, some grapefruit. Hops are really nice. For a brew its really nice, for a barleywine it misses some characteristics, could be more silky and smooth, less hops and more warming alcohol. Its more imperial IPA, then a barleywine. Still very enjoyable ofcourse.
A bit weak aroma of citrus, malt and fruits. Appearance is amber with white head. Flavor is sweet and bitter with clear taste of citrus .This is a very balanced beer.

Bottle from 2008. A nose of jam, strawberries, toffee, oak and alcohol. Taste is of strawberries, cookie, soil and a lot of funk, almost too much. Finish is salty and bitter and has a bit of alcohol in it. A solid BW.
Bottle from Bierkoning. Copper body with a sweet and hoppy nose, including grapefruit. Sweet taste with lots of malts. Nice citrus notes. And plenty of ABV to go around. Nice balance to it.
5th May 2008. A well balanced beer. Smooth and silky with a wack of malt witha druity undertone. Then floral hops that are dry and fruity but not overly bitter.  A real mouthfull.
Pours a clear amber yellow with close to no head. Aroma is hay, alcohol and cherry. Flavor is sugar and alcohol. Body is light syrupy with very light carbonation.

2009 vintage.

Reddish copper color with a slight chill hazy. A small off-white head with yellow hues settles rather quickly and leaves some lacings.

Plenty of hops in the smell - big notes of grapefruit and small hints of strawberries. Grass, floral notes and a general fruitiness. Sweet malts with a slightly bready character, fudge, nutty aromas and brown sugar. Incredibly well balanced. Great smell.

The taste is fantastic. Great balance between sweet malts and fresh hop aromas. Notes of grapefruit, strawberries, mango and cherries blend with pine-needles, floral notes and hop resins. A thick and very pleasant malty backbone with a somewhat toasty character - dark bread, nuts, chocolate and huge amount of sweet caramel. The finish is really bitter and contains fresh hop resins, a hint of tobacco, wood and gentle spices. The bitterness slowly fades away in a really long finish. A sweet taste of alcohol is noticeable, but its really integrated with the rest of the flavors.

Full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation.

A very good beer. Its almost unbelievable to think a beer as potent as this one can be so balanced, its practically flawless. Rich, powerful and complex, it doesnt get much better than that.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2010 Dark gold with white head. Aroma of rich caramel with a hint of sugar. Flavor is tons of brown sugar and molasses. Finishes smooth in the mouth.

Bottled. Aroma has caramel/sugar, lots of american piney hops, fruits and some alcohol. Clear, amber coloured beer with a short, off-white head. The taste is sweet, hopbitter with sugar and caramel malts, dried fruits/raisins. Quite well balanced for this kind of style.

Huge thanks to JW77 for sending me this bright pink abomination of a bottle in a trade.  It was the 05 as pictured.  Simply magical.  Hazy orange copper to brown in the glass.  Nose is super sweet, rich, spicy, full, round, and more adjectives.  Standouts were caramel and brown sugar.  Resilent lace.  Taste is creamy caramel, and brown sugar.  A distinct bit of spiciness and alcohol.  Dark fruit too.  One of my favorite barley wine experiences ever.  If I could add a .5 to my ratings the score would be higher.  Thanks a lot JW77.

09 Bottle tasted alongside the afore mentioned 05.  Crystal clear copper with light head and lace.  Nose is lightly nutty and creamy.  Aroma is similar to the 05, but much, much less.  Taste is light and sharp, with an alcohol nose.  Not tasting like a rich barley wine.  Some crisp lager characteristics melded with a strong ale.  It was a disappointment after drinking the artistic 05.  Rating score is obviously based on the 05 bottle.

Bottled. Clear amber color, short head. Big aroma of hop, caramel malt, slight alcohol. Bitter taste on a huge caramel malty body, quite thick, bit sweet. Slight sticky palate. Big big barley wine, very enjoyable.

A 2007 bottle with yellow wax, shared with BeerGestapo. It poured a dark hazy amber with a thin head. Swirling it around the snifter left an oily residue on the sides. The smell had notes of nuts, grass, toffee, and a faint hint of citrus. The flavor was toffee, grass, mint, pineapple, and earth. Sweet but at the same time full of hops. It had a thick syrupy body that was just a bit too sticky for my tastes. There was a bit of heat to it but well hidden for 12% abv.  A very good barleywine but maybe a bit overrated.
Pours an amber color with a thick off-white head and heavy lacing.  Pine, citrus, and caramel aroma.  Lacks sweetness, strong pnie and dry malt flavors.

Brewed in the USA... Courtesy of AFI96, thanks again waylo. Bottle from 2007 !!!  Pours a copper / amber color with a foamy off white head that will dissipate in time. Aroma of malts, spices, honey, caramel and hops. Taste of fruity malts, wood, caramel, mild hops and some alcohol warmth. Mouthfeel is well balanced, full bodied and the 12% is hidden very well. Overall, very tasty !! But i would like to add i believe this Barleywine is not quite as impressive as East Ends Gratitude.

Bottle. 2008 release. Nice, sweet malty backbone with sugary notes of caramel and some hint of fruity, citrus hops. This barley wine is so well balanced in my opinion. The alcohol is just barely traceable, but that doesnt make it any less drinkable. Medium-full body with an oily mouthfeel. Warm and comforting.

2009 bomber from Archer Liquors. Pours lightly hazy amber with a four finger beige/tan head. Aroma seems pine over sweet malt. Medium body with medium carbonation. Malt is strong. Hop bitter is citrus? Heat is minimal, given the abv. Head does some lacing. Might be a bit toffee towards the end. Pretty well balanced finish. Bitter and sweet all at once. Pretty impressive.

22oz bottle, 2009 edition blue wax thanks to pantanap. Pours a bright copper color, vigorously poured reveals a thick white head that goes down pretty quick. A sweet aroma, smooth and easy, sweet hops, honey, roasted caramel, sweetness and some bitter hops and alcohol. The flavor was unexpectedly smooth and somehow so easy to drink, I expected a hot hop bomb, but I was wrong; initial strong hops, bitter and smooth, a massive addition of burnt caramel- this is the best caramel profile ever I think, not overly sweet at all- light citrus and dry malts. Very little alcohol warmth. Leaves your palate with bitter hop flavors. Very nice.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2010 It poured a hazy copper golden liquid with a small white foam. It had a strong smell of grassy hops and flowers. The smell was thick and intense with some warm alcohol to build it up. It had a thick and heavy taste of caramell, hops and malt. High bitterness, very nice, a great beer!

bottle.  a badass barleywine.  amazing complexity and brilliantly masks the 12% volume.  tested 2007 batch which aged quite well and proved a treat to all who experiened the arousal that lies beneath the bosom of Miss Behemoth.

2009 bottle. Ruby red pour with a light beige head. Aroma of fruity hops, sweet malt. Malty flavor, caramel, piney hops, creamy sweetness. Great lacing on the glass showing each sip taken. Rich, flavorful beer. Aftertaste is great. Well-balanced complex beer. Alcohol is more noticeable as the beer sits for awhile. I like this beer a lot.
On tap at the brewery. This amber ale poured with a thick off-white head and a sharp alcohol aroma. There is a delicious caramel malt base with significant hop bitterness.

Last bottle I consumed a few months ago was Yellow so I guess it was over a year old if I had it in 08. 07 bottle. Aroma was really nice. Sweet with lots of juicy hops and malts. Citrus, caramel, molasses, honey and alcohol. Flavor has juicy hops balanced with cream and caramel and alcohol. Nice body and nice to drink.

2008 bottle split three ways in tulip glasses. The bottled poured produced a finger worth of tan head that went to a thick lace. The body of the brew was a copper red in color.

A nicely oxidized nose, sweet toffee and honey as well in the aroma. The flavor was great no hotness at all from the better than 12%. Big caramel and toffee flavors filled my mouth; the year in the bottle did it some good. The carbonation was spot on just enough to keep it from being syrupy with a medium feel in my mouth.
Good sip ability on this brew. One glass is enough in a sitting but the glass goes down mighty fine. This is a good American barleywine, worth seeking out in my book

Have had this one before, but did not rate it. Had some a couple nights ago,  thanks to "hannont". Colour... cloudy, amber-orange with an small ecru head. Nose... lots o hops, plenty o booze and fruity malts! Palate... plenty of C02 followed by hops out the wazzoo! Next, waves of candied citrus, Seville marmalade, sweet malt, cut grass, toffee, biscuits and an exceptionally loooooong finish!
Bottle courtesy of Allstar at Immys Backyard Throwdown. Pours amber in color with off white head. Aroma sweet, malty and hoppy. Taste malty, sweet, caramal and chocolate with bitter finish.
Pours dark brown. Reminds a lot of grapefruit, but with a hint of some nice candylike sourness. Really tickles the senses!

22 oz bottle of the 2007 vintage.  Pours cloudy caramel color with a short-lived light yellow-tan head.  Strong aroma of sweet caramel and white bread with hints of dark fruits.  Flavor has caramel, biscuit, and bread notes with some grassy hop presence and a touch of oxidation in the finish.  Flavor is a little off seemingly due to aging, but this is quite the nice barley wine.

Goblet poured draft at the brewpub (Munster, IN). Finally getting around to this. Pours a hazy amber with dark gold notes, a thick luscious eggshell white head that coats very well. Aromas are a nice piney and floral hoppiness, sweet malty caramel and pale malts underneath, a touch of strength with citrusy appeal. Initial is hoppy, a true American styled Barleywine preaching floral and citrus hops on the palate, delicate on the palate with good piney, florals, and citrus hops forward, pale malts are delicate with faint caramel and a touch of soap, faint candy like gumball, citrusy lemon, orange, and grapefruit melange. Finish decent bitterness, lighter sweetness, good flavors remain on the palate with a touch bitter, sweet citrusy, gumball, and faint tropical aftertaste. A fruit forward (American fruitiness) brew. Lovely. Cheers.

2008 Bottle. Poured amber with no head. Nose was huge booze, tons of citrus, lemon zest, grapefruit, etc., loads of sweet caramel, mild toast. Flavor was intense hops perfectly balanced by sweet malt and boozey goodness. I love everything about this beer. Everything.

Bottle @ Odense Smagning, August 2009. 2008 Vintage. Pours dark amber orange with a small creamy white head and lacings. Nose is sweet and vinous. Lots of hops, malts, toffee, caramel, fruit and vanilla. Sticky, vinous, creamy, smooth and complex. Long warm and hoppy end. A big Barley Wine.

Amber with a lasting white head. Intense malt aroma with lots of peach and pine hops behind it. Intense and huge sweet malty flavour with lots of pine hops for a near balance. Too sweet and big to drink a lot, but a wonderful sip!
Clear copper small light tan head. Aroma is very sweeet caramel loads of citrus hops. Very nice but just missing my overly high expectations.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2009 ྶoz 2007 yellow wax bomber) pours a nice dark amber, creamy bubbles resting on top and decent lacing. Nose is sweet sweet caramel, grassy hops, and reminds me of creme brulee (the dessert, not the beer). One of the best smelling beers Ive smelled ever. Taste is almost as good as the nose. Grassy and piney hops are balanced extremely well with the sweet caramel notes and the creaminess rounds it all out. Left finishing deliciously with only a mild bitterness and the toasted caramel as well. I loved this and it is one of the best barleywines I have ever had. Worth the nearly $20 price.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Øljunta Olympen Gathering. Low offwhite head. Dark amber colored, good clarity. Intense and delicious aroma of sweetish, crisp, grainy malts and floral/fruity hops. Big malt body; gently sweet, caramellish and grainy, and well rounded. A generous amount of fruity, resinous and floral hops to deal with it. Full-bodied. Thick mouthfeel. Strong malty, lasting bitter finish. Much of it all, yet balanced. A treat!
2009 bottle. Amber copper color pour.  Sweet and malty aromas. Caramelized fruits and a nice amount of hop flaver as well. Brought back from Chicago and glad I did! Great beer.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2009  Bottled. 3 Små Rum. 
Dark copper colour with diminishing head. Aroma from salmiak, chocolate and berries. Bitter flavour initially and loads going on here. Superb mouthfeel and flavour with red berry jelly, salty hops, chocolate, fruits, caramel. The salty hop bitterness is there all the way, but not disturbingly so. Salmiak suggestions after. Packed, integrated flavours.
UPDATED: AUG 15, 2009 Bottled 65cl. Very hoppy. Fantastic aroma- great taste. Complex. Extremely pleasant. Hints of lavender, rose and rosemary throughout.
Bottle. Frothy good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Very vinius. Moderate bitter flavor. Average finish. Very alcoholic. Creamy palate.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with medium creamy white mostly lasting head. Very nice complex aroma. Sweet fruity flavor. Bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Amber and a bit unclear. Has an off-white head, mostly lasting. Aroma of sweet malt, pure grain, faint sulfor, citrus, coco-nut. Flavor is heavy to harsh sweet, balanced with faint bitterness. Syrupy texture. Warming alcohol.
Clear amber color with small head, Strong flavor with a bitter hoppy finish.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are fruits, caramel, yeast and caramel. Vinous.
Bottle. Clear amber color with a small white head. Powerful complex aroma and taste of malts, caramel and hops. Laaasting taste.

08 purple wax.  huge waxy malt/bitter choc. very english-like on nosing. intense sweetish malt up front,that drys out  nicely on finish. balance is good for such a huge beer. wanted to find something wrong with this brew, but in all honesty, i couldnt.  DAMN GOOD

2009 bottle brought by buddy, copper pour little foam. nose is sweet malts big booze and some hops for balance so so well balanced was prob one of my fav barelywines. intrested to see what happens to my other 2 as they age

Clear amber pour, off-white head.  The nose is very hoppy, citrusy, with caramel and fruit.  The flavor is grapefruit, caramel, light fruit.  Wierd.  this is more like an IPA than a BW.  A very good IPA, but an IPA none the less.  The finish is again a citrus hop bittering, residual fruity sweetness.  Nice thick syrupy mouthfeel.  VERY enjoyable beer, but not my favorite BW.  I tend to like my barley wines to be darker, thicker, more fruity, less hoppy.

07 bottle release. Pours dark amber brown with a small brown head. Huge caramel, toffee, rum, raisin aroma. Smells thick and malty with a hop presence in the background. The flavor is big time fruity sweet with cherries, apricot, raisins, plums, chocolate, caramel, and toffee. The tartness of the beer sets in next with the cherry flavor taking the forefront. Then the piney bitter finish. Very thick body with powerful flavors that are all in harmony. This is a great barleywine. Its why I love barleywines actually. The sweet and sour flavors complement eachother like in no other beer Ive had.

2009 bottle from De Bierkoning.  Deep amber, clear with a yellowish, creamy and lacing head. Complex hoppy aroma- at first just grapefruit, then more floral notes as well as the bready maltiness appears. Good bready and hoppy flavours, citrus, warming alcohol, caramel. Full-bodied. Complex and well-balanced in all its extremity. Wondeful.

2007 bottle.  Poured a dark, clear amber with almost no head.  Nose is floral hop forward with lots of fruity esters and alcohol.  Medium to full body with soft carbonation and a syrupy mouthfeel.  Flavor is very sweet and fruity with a solid caramel backbone.  Lots of malt and floral notes.  Finishes sweet with lots of warming alcohol.

Time to catch up before BCTC. Bottle at PilsnerPeters Spring Throwdown. Thank to everyone who brought great beer and ribs and pickles and everything!  Medium dark orange.  Ripe orange in wood box aroma.  Toasty caramel biscuits with arangy hop bitter finish.  Sticky.

Blue Wax bought at Ølbutikken. Clear orange look with a thick baige head. Lots of grape and pine in the aroma, which got me exited, since i usually dont like Barley wines withaout loads of hops. Along with the hops comes some sweet caramel/toffee  notes, rye and nuts. First flavor impression was very complex yet very drinkable. Complex sweetness, good amount of hop bitterness and warming alchohol. Sticky palate. Awsome!

Bottle @ Ölbutikken. Amber color with a small white head. strong sweet hoppy aroma citrus grass pine. Taste is strong powerfull with a lot of hops citrus grapefruit earthly undertone some alcohol but very well balanced.

Bouteille de 22 oz partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez Glouglouburp. Arôme: Odeur dhoublon et de caramel légèrement sucré avec une pointe de vanille. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée. Présence dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel fruité avec une pointe de pamplemousse et dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #2506)

Damn. Rating #667 for this beer. 666 would have been sweet. Caught 4 bottles of 07 @ $5 a pop. Had 08 on draft. Nothing in comparison. Bottle better, so rated. Deep hazy ruby amber. Thick, smooth, enduring tan head. Smell is just, wow! Overload of citrus, caramel and fruit in the nose. Taste is big. Sticky. Cherries, berries, citrus, pine, and caramel. Impressive hops year+ after bottling. Warming, but not apparently hot. Almost an oaky edge. 1299 would be reasonable. Just too pricy to indulge. Savor.
Pours dark amber with a small head.  Heavy aroma of sweet hops.  Tastes very much like Founders Devil Dancer.  Great beer.

22oz blue wax 2009 bottle purchased at DLD 09. Pours a clear, amber-orange body with a thin, white head that leaves a good amount of whispy lacing on the surface and the glass. A simple swirl arouses the head easily. Aroma is big on the floral hops with some resins and sweet pines. Lots of caramels and a soft molasses. Big citrus, mostly grapefruit and tangerines, as well as a hint of berry raisin. Extremely hoppy aroma. Flavor is no different. Starts with a soft caramel sweetness before the pines and florals grab the attention. The cool thing about this is that hops dont attack the palate even though they are pretty intense, but rather walk proudly with their chests thrusting and their egos high. Some more sweet caramels as well as a mixture of fruit join the parade before some molasses, honey, and peppery spicing ends this one all the while being led by a high amount of pines. Finishes very dry and grassy with a slight cloy. Lots of grassy, syrupy bitterness in the aftertaste with a deeper caramel and light alcoholic warmth. Palate is medium bodied and slightly sticky with a touch of carbonation. Overall, this is an extremely hoppy barley wine. Ive never had anything like it. Personally, I feel that the intense floral and pine flavors take away some of the stylistic qualities that I tend to like in a barley wine, but this is still damn good, especially the aroma. Props to FFF for balancing a "behemoth" like this.

Original review date 10/27/2008...

Cloudy, caramel bourbon color. Dry ginger head shows for a few minutes and is off. Lacing is moderate with a few sediment lines.

Wow - smells like hoppy French toast! Maple syrup, caramel, salt, vanilla - hops have some subdued citrus and maybe a little grass. Bitterness is profound even though traditional hop elements may be tempered. With warmth hop character becomes more lightly floral absent any perfume.

This is a cinder block to the head. Creamy caramel - even a little buttery (diacetyl?) but not offensive. Boozy floral/grass hopy...all in abundance. Stewy and soup with even a little broccoli in there. Crazy.

Tight mouth at first. With warmth of course this opens up nicely. Almost salty soup with stew over abundant malt. Boozy to an extent but oh so comfortably warming.

Admittedly this is a sentimental favorite - this was the one that started it all - the first uber-hopped barleywine I ever came across, courtesy of the Floyd blokes at the 1999 GABF. Several years later its still boozy, heavy and hoppy as all hell...and it works! A great pleasure to savor and contemplate the rare times I get a chance to enjoy this one.

Year-old bottle from hannont - thanks Todd!  Purple wax cracked in June 09.  Aroma is really mellow, dark, syrupy with notes of brown sugar, cough syrup, roast.  Flavor is much the same but I found myself fixated on funky cherries and old, juicy hops that had mellowed into resin.  Tastes surprisingly like Arctic Devil but way mellower.  Thanks again Todd this was the heat!

2009 bottle from Cracked kettle.

Smells of sweet  citrusy hops, figs, congac, oak barrels and candy.

Taste of grape seeds, malt, citrus.

Big body.

2008. Dark reddish amber pour with small white head. Lacing is phenomenal, some wandering legs are present as well. Fruity esters and piney, grapefruit hops dominate the aroma with caramel and toffee malt coming through secondarily. Flavor is primarily sweet malt- caramel toffee, fruit, and molasses. Hop backbone is quite evident with grapefruit notes culminating with a woody almost earthy note. Palate is smooth and soft, finishing fiery in the bottom of the throat. Extremely quaffable and well balanced. A lovely example of the style.

2008 vintage. Red mahogany pour with a small, white bubbly head. Aroma is very nice; caramel, apricot, and plum mix with a nice citrusy hop aspect. Seems to be not too aggressive, more mellow despite the 12% ABV. Flavor definitely conveys more of an American than English barleywine style; rich citrus hop presence combines with the fruity malt character, and the alcohol burn at the end is extraordinary. Immensely smooth in the palate, slides down the throat gracefully. Excellent brew.

2008bottle, purple wax.  dark reddish pour.  Hoppy, caramelized malt, a little bit of wood.  Mellow aroma.  Smooth mouthfeel, nice booziness, some wood and some great caramel malt.  Some toffee as well, and the hops come through with some bitterness that offsets the sweetness nicely.  Not especially complex but agressive and the burn of alcohol in the finish is welcomed.  Very tastey
2008 Bottle. Pours with a large off-white head and a amber body. Nose of pine hops and malt. Sweet flavour with hops, pine, malt and caramel. Full bodied. Pleasant bitter finish.

$18 bottle from Steves Liquor new location in Madison.  Pours a copper color with a medium off-white head which leaves a few streaks of sticky lacing.  Aroma is apricot, toffee, caramel malts, piney hops, and alcohol.  Taste has a base of caramel and toffee and finishes with a piney bitterness, with some apricot and sherry in there as well.  Meh.  Didnt satisfy my expectations.  Seems to be the norm when it comes to Three Floyds.

Thanks to my brother for sharing this.  Pours a rich deep copper color with thin whispy white head.  Aroma is rich hop profile with some caramel malt and light alcohol notes.  Taste is pretty hoppy with some notes of apricot, pear and caramel all mixing up quite well.  This beer finishes smooth with just a bit of alcohol warmth.  Good stuff.  However, at $18 a bomber, there are more barleywines to be had at a better price.

on tap at fff brewpub and purchesed a couple bombers.  it pours a golden red color with a tiny white head.  The smell is of dried fruits and citrus.  the taste is is a nice bitter hoppiness along with a sweet and fruity taste.  This will be good on a cold winter night to warm you an a loed one up.
This poured a reddish amber color. The flavor is sweet but hoppy at the same time. An alcoholic finish. I wasnt very impressed with this one.

Bottle. Ap: Golden amber. Small white head. Ar: Incredible sweet with a touch of citrus hops. Candy hops! Grapes, fig, cognac. Fla: Sweet. Some raisins, but too much like in way too many barley wines. Some hop bitterness. A little too inviting, fruity and uncomplex for its own good. Ov: Big boodied, very smooth and inviting. More elegant than agressive.

Good creamy head and carbonation in a misty beautiful apricot/peach coloured barleywine,great look.Aroma fruity,grapefruit,richness sugar,nutty peach note,doughy.flavour good hoppyness,bitter,citrus,some citric peel,grapefruit,resinous taste,toffee,piney caramel,malt,fine brewery,cherries have a big taste,alcohol well hidden,finish big hop taste maslt bliss,lovely bitter so good.

2008 bottle.

Uniltered amber/gold, quickly disappearing medium bubble size/non-homogenous head.

Very fruity/sweet. Hop also very evident in aroma.

Full bodied, medium fizzy.

Medium sweet, changing to hoppy, then slowly fading out as a mix of sweet and hoppy. Nice symphony and balance.

 No clear alcohol presence underlines the quality.

 Purchased in Ølbutikken.

Vertical with 05, 07, 08 and 09.  Well, this was a surprise.  The color of the 05 is easily the darkest and most cloudy.  It pours a cloudy dark brown with a surprisingly large tan head.  The aroma is bannana bread, cloves, cinnamon, alcohol and brandy.  The flavor is deep and rich: banana, cinnamon, caramel malt, notes of brandy and port.  This one has really held up well, very little evidence of oxidation.  The 07 poured deep cloudy brown (lighter than the 05) with a smaller tan head.   Aroma is caramel malt, prunes, notes of hay and grass, cloves and alcohol.  Flavor of this one is a bit more oxidized than the 05.  Was better after I let it breathe for a while.  Caramel, cinnamon, faint faint hop, and oxidation in the finish. The 08 is much lighter: copper with small tan head.  Aroma is malty, butterscotch, pine hop background, clove, and raspberries.  Flavor is true to nose with long hop, coffee, and caramel finish.  The 09 is crystal clear brown with small tan head.  Aroma is less robust than others: floral, pine hops and caramel malt.  Flavor is true to nose with long pine hop finish and malt.  For me: 05>08>09>07.  The 05 really held up well; the 07 not as much. Rating is an overall compilation. 05-4.4/07-3.8/08-4.1/09-3.9

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2012 First ratingGreen or blue wax bottle (2009?)On June 5, 2009Hazy copper color, off-white head. Hoppy, citrus, apricots, apple scent. Swet, hoppy, alcohol, bitter taste. Smooth mouthfeel, high bitterness.Very nice!9/3/9/4/18=4.3RerateBottle brought to the Feb 26, 2011 tasting, probably by Honka and Delaval (not on ratebeer).Green or blue wax versionHazy amber color, yellow head. Sweet, grainy, alcohol, fresh, milky, fruity scent. sweet, malty, fresh, bitter taste. Smooth mouthfeel, high bitterness.9/4/9/4/18=4.4RerateGreen or blue wax version, sort of hard to tell.Bottled at Bishops Arms Järntorget, Göteborg, during "Porterveckan 2012". On November 25, 2012.Cloudy amber color, off-white head. Sweet, malty, hoppy scent. Sweet, malty, apricot taste. Smooth, full mouthfeel. Medium high bitterness.Very nice!8/3/9/5/18=4.3

Bottle 2009. Dark orange/brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma: Hops up front, fruitiness, caramel, soup, pine, lightly floral, oranges/mandarines. Taste: Hops, grape, pine, fruitiness, caramel, sweetness, soup, pine, alcohol. Bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Very american. Not very complex. I expected more considering the hype.

PPRBSG09.  Bottle, Blue wax 09?  Pours an amber body with an off white head.  Grass y pear, chewy malts.  SOME strong earth y hoppiness with a big raw sugar etoh warming.  Not bad i remember enjoying the 2007 more.

Bottled from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Orange/amber coloured, small but lasting head. Very hoppy nose, pine, nice. Very harsh flavour, alcoholic, bitter, complexity of the aroma is nowhere to be found. Fair, but lacking complexity considered its gravity. And pretty damn expensive for what you get.

Source:  2007, 22 oz bottle in a trade via illinismitty. Glass: Gulden Drak Tulip. Appearance: Ruddy orange/amber pour with a thin tan head that quickly dissipated.  Aroma:  Fruit, sweet malt, sherry, a hint of brown sugar, and a lot of alcohol. Flavor: Flavor was surprising simple...but good.  Dark fruits, caramel malt and warming alcohol. Palate:  Full bodied with soft carbonation and a chewy mouthfeel.Overall:  I didnt think this was great, but it was definitely above par.

bottle from Three Floyds on DLD.  

Pours a delicious fat golden amber with off white head.  The aroma is complex with notes of caramel, apricot, apple, spicy hops, citrusy hops, and piney hops.  The flavor is equally delicious, pummeling my tongue with caramels, fruits, alcohol, and hops.  The mouthfeel is thick and sticky but great.  Overall, this is very well balanced and delicious.  Another win for the Floyds and Co.

2007 bottle in late 2008. pours a clear amber with minimum head. aroma is sweet and sugary almost. deep red fruits and some alcohol. flavor is sweet and rich of dried plums, raisins, caramel, and alcohol. really good stuff.

Did another tasting of Barley Wine style ales tonight.  This won out compared to the Mikkeller and Dieu du Ciel.  I liked the palate - thicker pour like I would expect - more viscous than the other 2, silky on the tongue - minimal up-front bitterness, just soft and warm.  Almost a roasted, carmel, nose.  Decent head, and a brightness of middle that was fundamentally apricot.  Nice, soft, finish as well.  I prefer serving at room temp.  My favorite is still Bigfoot, so will need to do a side by side tomorrow.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2010 WOW! Only second to DL for me as 3Fs go. Amber with white head Lovely hop aroma with hugely complex citrus, pine and caramel notes. Need to taste this one again.

Tasted 2008 bottle @ Brewstore Alvinne. With Glenn, William, ...
Almost clear golden color, with a little white head.
Aroma  strong fruits, florial hops and malts. 
Medium body.
Taste is good hops, alcohol notes, finish with a sweet bitterness. GOOD.

Botella. Huge thanks to Pinball for sharing. Clear golden bit dark amber colour, small but steady thick white creamish head. Very ripe fruity, citrus hoppy intense pleasant aroma. Very good filling mouthfeel. Ripe fruity, piney, flowery hoppy caramel flavour. Long lasting great dry hoppy fruity piney alco finish. Yum indeed1

Daytona 500 tasting. 2007 vintage bomber. Dark, clear amber with a beige head. Excellent nose of sweet raisin and caramel, big floral hop presence. Flavor is big - sweet fruit and floral bite, booze is well hidden. I loved this one!

0.65 l bottle, thanks oh6gdx! Dark amber color. Sweetish, warming, nutty, fruity and hoppy aroma with mango, apricot and hint of solvent. Bittersweet flavor with toffee, nuts, fruity-sweaty hops and warming 
alcohol. Tasty allthough hop character is slightly sweaty.

65cl bottle from ølbutikken.
clear amber , small white head.
aroma is piny, citrussy, hops. hops dominate. also some fruits, mango.
flavor is pine, caramel, foral notes, alc is well hiddeen, bitterhops, dark fruits. very well balalnced,very tasty, probably the best barley wine ive had so far (1600+ ratings).
palate is thick and nice. very good mouthfeel.
Pours an orangish-tinted brown with a small head. Amazingly strong and good aroma of caramel, chocolate, citrus and mint.
22oz Bottle. Picked this one up at DLD 09. Served slightly chilled, but not ice cold. Taste of citrus and hops, nice sweet aftertaste.

Sweet, malty and very hoppy barley wine, doesnt make me wax poetic but this is still a good beer. Citrusy hops work, the sweetness is nicely in balance with that but I wouldnt say this is vinous really at all. The text in the label is pushing it.The pine needle hops are still quite a thing to taste and smell in a barleywine. Well done but not so special for the style.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Bottle, thanks to Bigmmartin.  Aroma was strong with grassey, florial hops and malts.  Notes of citrus really jump out.  The flavor is sweeter than I expected with a crisp alcohol burn.  Hops stand out through the whole experience, biting you at the end with a sweet bitterness.  Not what I would expect in a barleywine, but, wow, what a great beer!

Rerate- had an aged 2008 bottle.  THis one was more like a barley wine.  Not near as much hop aroma or flavor.  It was more dark fruits, carmel malts, and apricot.  Night and day difference between a fresh one and an aged one.  Still enjoyed it very much.
Pours out amber color with some foam. Taste is hoppy and malty. Sweet fruity notes with nice bitter hops. Low alcohol burn, very drinkable.

this was my surprise of the night at dld 09.  Not all that experienced with barley wines but this was one that impressed me immensely.  Seemed to me like a imperial ipa (I actually preferred this to the dreadnaught).  Big hops in the nose and flavour wise but a fair bit sweeter than expected.  EAsy drinking for abv.  Complex mix of hops some citrus, espec grapefruit and sugary sweetness. Really good

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2009  Bottle (blue wax)Pours a copper in color. Light tan head. No lace. Aroma is strong with many fruits and herbs. I smell alot of Caramel/nut toffee, grapes and apples.A ton of hops. A lot going on in the aroma. The taste is of alcohol, Caramel, toffee grapes, pineapples  and a smoke tobacco. You start off tasting the alcohol then it moves into the dark flavors then the fruit flavors. very full and filling beer. The after taste is long and very bitter with high levels of alcohol. Very very good.

Bottle. Medium high fluffy but lasting off-white head. Clear amber body. Lovely and powerful apple pear honey caramel aroma, sweet but good. Flavor also strong and good with a dry, spicy and hoppy caramel honey fruityness. Low carbonation and a long bitter aftertaste. In spite of the high alcohol percentages this is not too much of a good thing. Alcohol can be tasted but mingles in a fine way with the hops bitterness.

2007 bottle (Yellow Wax). Pours a dull copper color, capped with a small khaki head that dissipates quickly. Beautiful aroma, with loads of hops, toffee, caramel, molasses, grapefruit and honey. Flavor is caramel for an instant, then resinous hops take over. Grapefruit, herbs, tobacco and honey round out the palate. Hops resins cling to the palate for a long finish. Medium bodied and silky smooth. Nice b-wine, but I wish it lived up to its aroma.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2009 Bottled at Tre små rum, Gothenburg
Amber with a small head.
Musty, malty aroma along with hoppiness.
Smooth mouthfeel.
Hoppy with some toffee, tropical fruits and grassy hoppiness.
Long, sweet, bitter finish.

2008 bottle from TheEpeist, thanks! Sark amber color. Plums, raisin and earthy hops in the aroma. Strong alcoholic flavor with grapes, plums, oak and pineapple. Pipe tobacco. Firm beer, malty sweet and with a good complexity.

the bottle I had was purple wax.
The nose was great on this. typical barelywine. Malty, some hops coming though.
The color was copperish. Damn this was a good barelywine

Bottled (thanks jjpm74!). Amber colour, medium beige head. Aroma is caramel, alcohol, some fruity hops and also mild burnt sugar. Flavour is hoppy, grassy, quite sticky. Toffee and some some alcohol. Mild nutyness as well.

Bottled (yellow wax = November 2006, Vasa session). 
Dark amber-brown color, small off-white head. Caramel, citrusy hops, bread and white pepper in the nose, also some fruity notes. Sweetish toffee, caramelly brew with bready and hoppy flavors, Alcohol rises in the finish. A bit liquerish palate. Heavy stuff. Not really very complex, but good sipping beer.

Bottle at 3 Små Rum, Göteborg. Amber/orange color, small offwhite head. Aroma from tropical fruits, peach, pear, pine apple, grapfruit, grass and hops. Malty, sugary notes, some caramel, grassy, spicy flavor, really hoppy, grapefruit, salty and some salmiak. Long pleasant bitter finish with grass and salt.

bottle through trade, purple wax. poured an amber in color with some orange highlights and a fluffy off white head that stuck around. aroma has caramel malt, bitterness, light citrus, and some sweet fruit. mouth feel coats well and there is light carbonation. flavor is very smooth for such a big beer. hefty caramel malt, pines, bitterness, and dark fruit. nice sweetness balances this well, and the high alcohol content is nowhere  to be found.
bomber. Pours Redish orange with off white head. Aroma is sweet malts, hops, caramel and citrus. Flavor is malt, caramel, hops, caramel, and some spices, balanced yet bold. Good stuff.

At tasting session by Joes. A clear amber colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma of hop bitters with sweet fruits, this moves over to bitter fruits. The taste is hop bitter, with fruits like grapes and citrus. There hints of malts and some notes of alcohol. The aftertaste is bitter and a bit syrup. A beer with complex aromas and taste.

Blue wax.  Purchased at Lakeview Binnys.  Its aight.  Pretty light bodied for a 12% barley wine, this had none of the malty fullness and richness I like in my barley wines -- its pretty much a hoppy american strong.  Nice billowing "racing" and sudsy sparce lacing with a head that mostly dissipates over a dark amber beer.  Theres some sweet golden raisin on the nose (much more than in the mouth), accented by floral and oily hops.  Caramel sweetness in the mouth is dark and not too distinct, mostly acting as a nondescript baseline around which the hops play, sometimes juicy, always bitter.  Not a bad beer at all, but my barley wine tastes are fairly specific, and this doesnt push the right buttons for me (I dont know why I rate barley wines more "to style" than any other style, but I do -- and by "to style" I mean "to what I want it to be").
Had at the EBF 2009. Golden brown with a small tan head. Fruity nose with hints of pine and citrus. Great beer. Glad I finally got to try it.

Yummy barleywine, too easy to drink but still.. Lovely hop profile. Very american (wich I like) and very bitter (wich I like) and very well balanced with no sign of the high ABV. Finishes of on the sweeter side but still with a good underlaying bitterness and some warmth in the belly. Great.
Dark Orange color that that tastes like an orange with piney and bitter hops was my first ever barley wine had it on  tap bought 4 24oz to age in my cellar cant wait to age it

courtesy of Tony at OTH.
06 version.
pours deep dark orange with no head.
Aroma is malty with strong scent of brown sugar/caramel.
Taste, malty, sugary with very light hints of hops that had some light grapefruit bitterness and caramel.
Simply delicious.

F*** my *ss Thats a barley wine.I had this as a young barley wine and it is magnificent now ive got an aged one in my cellar, im gunna let it sit for a couple more years. One thing i really liked about this BW is that it has excellent hop character!
draft at three floyds.  fruity, sweet, big, nice.  i liked it.  great from tap but would like to try an aged version.

2006 yellow wax Bottle thanks to tearsforbeers!!  A quest beer that Ive been searching for since the beginning.  Aroma has notes of citrus, almonds, and caramel.  Hazy orange amber hue with a large cascading frothy off-white head that mostly diminished and left good lace.  Flavor is sweet complex and bitter.  Palate is full bodied and oily soft.  Top notch barley wine that is so well done its hard to find any faults.  One of the best BWs that should continue to get better with age. Bravo!

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2009 Awesome!   Finesse, depth and many layered flavors.  All I could think when drinking was, "Damn, this tastes like a caramel apple at the fair".  Big and rich without being heavy and cloying like so many Barley wines.   About as good as it gets!

Copper to golden brown in color with a thin tan head.Smell is sweet and very powerful. Pine and hops is the first thing I noticed followed by caramel and mandarin oranges.Tastes like Mandarin orange at first then pine and a bitter hops. It has a great sweet and bitter combination. Has a definate alcohol feel to it at 12.5%.Has a dry and bitter finish with very light carbonation.

22 oz. bottle - yellow wax; 2007 vintage; pours mostly clear and dark copper with frothy tan head dissipating to the edges; this one is quite strong on the nose with brown sugar, alcohol, leaves, musky wood and oranges; soft, light, fruity and sweet going down; smooth, but heat is obvious; had aged well from what i can tell; slightly bitter with caramel and fruit; lovely creamy texture as it warms; awesome stuff

22 oz. bottle courtesy of a trade with brentfeesh.  2007 bottle.  Pours a hazy golden amber with a thin off-white head that faded to a ring after two sips and left partial lace.  Very pleasant aroma of caramel, oranges and alcohol.  The flavor is caramel up front followed by some strong, almost prickly hops bitterness, which continues well beyond the swallow.  There is noticeable flavor and heat from the alcohol as well, with the heat also lingering beyond the swallow.  Not at all smooth.  Full bodied.  There are elements of this beer that I enjoyed, but overall, there are other barley wines I would reach for first.

Bottle from MaltOMeal at the February Houston Tasting.  Thanks, Bill!  Pours a thick cheddar orange with an aroma of strawberry kolache and sugar bread.  Flavor is leafy, pond scum hops with weird fruit swirls.  Thick mouthfeel.  Eh, its okay.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: 2007 bottle sampled at the Hopsnobbery Collective barley wine tasting on 3.14.09.  Cloudy amber color with a medium off-white head.  Grainy malt aroma with some alcohol mixed in.  Flavor is pretty much the same with some hop balance in the finish.  Good stuff.

February Houston Tasting. Thanks to Maltomeal for bringing this. Pours a rich gold with a thin head. Nose of malt, sweetness and grapefruit. Flavor is apricots, red grapefruit. Smooth and rich...great beer.

07 bottle. Big thanks to Bobby91w for this one! Pours a murky amber with a thin, dense, light tan head that fades to a film. Aroma has a bunch of citrus hops, a ton of big caramel malts, and breakfast cereal (grain). Flavor shows the alcohol, but certainly doesnt seem like 12%. Tons of smooth, malty goodness with a great hop backbone - its great when its this mellow, but Id love to try it fresh, too - the hop oils have definitely broken down. Some apple and grapefruit notes, as well. Really, really good - FFF doesnt fail to impress. Cant wait to try more from them.

On tap at FFF brewpub - Pours a hazy amber with a very little head. Its all hops on the nose, which was unexpected. Taste is an intense hops blast right off the bat, progressing into a malty mellowness. There are some carmel flavors, maybe a little toffee. Real thin on the mouth...again, surprising. Overall, a great beer, but not what I thought it was going to be.

Rotten Apple tasting.  Light amber color.  Tan head with nice lacing that fills the glass.  Aroma is not big and offers grassy and citrus hop.  Amazingly smooth feel.  Alcohol warming but only faintly tasted.  Hop presence comes late and big.  Excellent!

Holy $#!%, this is one of the best beers I have ever had.  It looks perfect, smells beautiful and is extremely complex.  You could write a book to describe it.  Do not take my word for it, buy it, try it, love it.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2010 Bottle at Jerrys. Cloudy copper with big, foamy beige head / Nose of fresh cut pine, brown sugar, and cooked citrus / Full body, excellent balance between moderately sweet malts and sharp hops, with good, although somewhat hot, finish / Flavors of cut pine, resin, brown sugar, cooked grapefruit & orange, and  / A good bw, or triple ipa, but not worth the high price.

bomber thanks to me.  Shared at the February Houston Tasting.  Pours a cloudy amber with no head.  nose was fruity and caramel malt.  Taste was fruity as well with a nice hop taste.  Mouthfeel was creamy.

Bottled sample with yellow wax. Amber in colour with medium carbobation. Aromas of oranges chewy malts, honey and cereal grains. Fairly heavy in the mouth with elements of grainy and caramelly malts, cracked wheat, C-hops, and black pepper. Long finish to this one, with a bit of a spicy hop flourish right at the end. Nice and mellow at this stage, but Id like to try a fresh one at some point.
Pours dark amber. Aroma: is pine, herbs, and some alcohol. Flavor: sweet, pine, strawberries, brandy, and caramel.
Red amber in color with a good sized cream colored head. Aroma is of brown sugar, spices and hops. Taste is of brown sugar, fig, caramel, spices and hops.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2009 In short: An unusually refreshing fruity  and hoppy Barley Wine.  Could almost pass as a big Double IPA.  Excellent
How: Bottle 22oz.  2008 batch (purple wax), purchased at the brewery and consumed when 8 months of age
The look: Cloudy dark orange body topped by a persistent medium white head
In long: The pleasantly hoppy nose is unusual for a barley wine with notes of clementines, resin and caramel.  Taste is really smooth and refreshing despite the gravity.  Body is full and pillowy with a soft carbonation.  A lot of juicy fruity caramel.  Dried fruits, apricots, tangerines, citrus fruits, tropical fruits, even pineapples.  Juicy resinous leafy hops almost balance the whole thing out leaving a little residual sugar in the finish.  Blind tasting I would have called it an IIPA.  Turn that little residual sugar in rich caramel and this would be perfect.  Amazingly drinkable, this has got to be the most refreshing barley wine Ive ever had.  And when talking about a Barley Wine refreshing is a word I use as rarely as please and thank-you in my day-to-day life.

The aroma is right for the style as it pertains to american Barley Wines. There is plenty of hops, more than many of the style but not more than seems appropriate. It is both citrusy and Piny. There is also sweet malt and carrot juice. The appearance is perfect for the style with a larger head than many imported Barley Wines. The flavor is like the style with a bitter finish and very well hidden alcohol. The palate is appropriate for the style. Overall its a good example of the style. Actually its got some qualities that I wish other would have but I could do without the carrot taste.
nice barley wine. has got some strong malts with a bit of caramel flavor, alcohol is hidden extremely well, better than most other beers. slightly sweet at the end great all around.

On tap at FFF.  Dark amber color with a khaki-colored head.  Really hoppy aroma with citrus and pine notes, as well as lots of sweet syrupy caramel malt.  This is one hell of a hoppy barleywine, reminiscent of their Dreadnaught IPA.  Flavor is incredibly well-balanced with sweet malt and bitter, flavorful hops.  Dark fruit notes also.  Alcohol is well hidden, so if you can drink large quantities of hoppy beer like me then this will have you under the table in no time.

2005 Bottle - Thanks BuckeyeBoy - Pours a rich amber with a tiny tan head...aroma is citrus hop, pine, maple syrup...in the mouth, this still has some fire, dark malt profile and some cinnamon spice on the end...very enjoyable and definitely can stand the cellar...I can only imagine that popping a 2008 is like getting kicked in the mouth...

Yellow wax.  Pours a dark transparent caramel colored body with a tight off-white head.  Smells of caramel, vanilla and candied almonds fill the nose.  The pallate is smooth and just a bit dry but with very little alcohol soak.  Flavors of caramel malts, vanilla, dates, and dried dark fruit dominate and I know it sounds weird but I got some sense of a chewing on the wooden stick after eating a drumstick, the ice cream treat... whatever.  I was blown away by the balance of this beer.  It was rich and dessert like, amazing.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Hazy amber color with a beige head. Aroma of pine needles, resin, some cookies, malt, some fruitiness and a bit of alcohol. Sweet malty flavor at first with some dark bread, caramel and some plums notes turns into bitter piney hops. Full-bodied. Good stuff.

Purple wax, deep orange with nice tan head, aroma of lemon cheese yeast grapefruit clove very nice sweetness, deep sweet and noticable pleasant alocohole, grapfruits and vanilla can be sensed, amazing balance, great beer

22oz bottle, 2008 purple wax, amber-orangeish color, with a fluffy beige head, leaving laces, sweet toasty, fruity, floral hop nose of candied peaches, apricots, orange peels and marmalade, with a liquorish brandyish, Grand marnier note, with some coniferous, resinous, piney accents in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a sweet toasted, caramelized malt, flowery hop fruity character, of candied peaches, apricots, orange peel, with a juicy hopped leafy, grassy, coniferous, minty accent, within a warmth liquorish Grand Marnier mouthfeel, leading towards a fruity, candied peachy, marmalade, minty, hop leafy dry bitterness finish.

2008 Bomber, purple wax.  Pours a slightly hazy amber with red hues.  Nice off white head with good retention and lacing.  Aroma of pine, citrus, resin, and some decent malt.  Flavor is much the same, with a little sweet malt up front.   Palate is perfectly smooth and hides the ABV very well.  I cant say that this is the type of BW that I have had often, a lot more hoppy than I am used too.

22oz bomber, purple wax, courtesy of SixPackSunday poured into a tulip.

Pours a dark, slightly hazy reddish amber with a small cream-colored head that dissipated pretty quickly and left pretty good lacing.

Aroma has some pretty sizable hops up front with some grapefruit and grassy hops.  Plenty of caramel malts and toffee and dark fruits.

The hops are a little more toned down in the taste and the sweet dark fruits and caramel malts dominate a little more.  Its really sweet throughout with some brown sugar as well.

The mouthfeel is medium to full-bodied and sticky sweet with some a little soft carbonation.

This is a fairly sweet barleywine with a fading hop profile that balances things our very well.  For the ABV, its a crazy drinkable beer.  Very tasty.

22 oz bottle with yellow wax (2007). Poured a small white head, that dissipated quickly. Pretty nice lacing. Smells of caramel, vanilla, with some hops and malt mixed in. Tastes of caramel and vanilla quite strongly, and maybe a little citrus. Goes down with some hop bite at the end, but quite full-bodied, and the taste stays throughout. Overall quite good though.

66 cl. bottle. [Trade with hopscotch and the Florida Crew, thanks buddy] Small fizzy off-white head that mostly diminished. Spare display of lacework. Dark amber color. Aroma was very smooth yet extremely complex with notes of rye bread, grapefruit, nuts, mild pine like, caramel, fruit. Over the palate came oak, citrus, fruit, brad and caramel. Full bodied with a soft carbonation and mild dry alcoholic texture. Heavy sweet flavor with good counter bitterness. Lingering grape and heavy bread like finish. One more please!

With the upcoming release of the 2009 Behemoth, I felt it would be nice to retaste the 2008.  It has evolved beautifully.  While some of the over-the-top hoppiness upon release has dropped out.  The hop/malt balance is extraordinary.

2008.  Pours mahogany.  Some nice floral aroma with peach and cherry, some pine hoppiness, bread, caramel, and roasted malts.  Slight alcohol aroma present.  Lots of caramel flavor with intense citrus hops, slight earthiness, and some fruitiness.  Extremely smooth, and the palate is far less sticky than I expected.  Nice.
Huge body on this one.  I knew I would like it the minute I poured it.  2007 bottled sample from the brewery.  Can’t wait to get another bottle

Bottled at Chris O’s tasting, 26th Sept 2008. Reddish orange with a strong candy sugar aroma. The robust malts hide the hops and the taste is quite salty. Palate is ok but overall I found it rather disappointing.
Bottle at Craigs house. caramel, floral, brown, light sweetness, light body, sticky,

Bottle at home ... leaving me only 2 more to complte my top 50 beers with 250 ratings...2007 bottle ... deep copper big foam head ... big sweet american hop with a fair ammount of malt in nose ... big sweet piney citrus hop ... lots of caramel ... light vanilla ... warming soft spirit ... medium bitterness... soft carbonation ... Think this would age wonderfully.

2008 purple wax bomber. Luscious aromas of sweet caramel malt , and citrusy hops. Super smooth and full bodied. Initial flavors of sweet maltiness, and then the upfront hop bitterness kicks in. These deep flavors do not go away soon and last in your mouth for a good long time. Excellent balance of complex flavors. Intense fantastic Barley Wine.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2009 From a 22 oz bottle with a purple wax top (2008) that took a while to pry off, this poured a clear and simply gorgeous deep amber color with a slightly off-white head and thick and sticky lacing rings.   The nose is caramel malts and vanilla, but powerful. There is also lots of hops in the aroma with pine, flowers, citrus, and ripe fruit. Very rich and slick mouthfeel. with moderate carbonation. Flavor is a mirror of the nose, and is delicious to drink. Long bitter finish and it hides the alcohol well.  One of the best Barley Wines ever. I just had the 2009 version, and it is still just as good at the 2008..
Bottle 2008 Purple top. Aroma of caramel, grapefruit and pine. This is a nice barley wine with a lot of hop flavors. Caramel, malt, vanilla and grapefruit and pine.

Clear reddish amber with tiny off white head. Sweet aroma with plenty of hops, toasted malt and caramel. Serious amount of hops in the flavour with grapefruit and pine notes. This one finished delicious bitter.

Bottle at ØLbutikken - thanks Jeppe. Clear deep red/brown - offwhite head. High hoppy (American hoppy - Three Floyds hoppy...), sweetness, caramel, ryebread, nutty, dark fruits, choclate notes, pine, grass, pine needles, amber malts, citrus, light alcoholic, smooty body. Lovely.

Bottle. I tried the 2007 and 2005 vintages side by side. The 2005 vintage poured a hazy dark orange color and had an off white head. It smelled of cotton candy, toffee, caramel, and dark fruits such as black cherry and fig. Medium to full bodied and sweet with molasses and toffee flavors dominating. 7/4/7/4-16.

The 2007 vintage was not quite as good. It poured a clear medium orange color and smelled of candle wax, cotton candy, and dog food. Medium to full body with brown sugar, subdued dog food, alcohol, cherry, and molasses flavors. 7/4/6/3-14.

OK, does it count if I’ve only tasted this as part of a recipe?  Birreria Paradiso in Georgetown made a caramel sauce for an ice cream Sunday out of this beer, and paired it with a Moloko Stout during a Three Floyd’s tasting given by two f the brewers.  Great combo, and delicious sauce.  Thumbs up for beer-food pairings, and the use of beer in recipes.

2005 Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy deep amber with a small off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is sweet caramel, candied fruit, citrus hops, and sweet malt. Taste is loaded with a tons of silky sweet caramel, citrus hops, and a fruity finish. Medium full mouthfeel with a moderate amount of bitterness and smooth alcohol. Very good.

Thanks to kylefleeger for cracking this bottle of 2008.  Pours a warm amber color from the bomber with a creamy off-white head.  Looks as great as it tastes.  Brimming with the sweet flavors of gingerbread, brown sugar, spiced citrus, and vanilla.  Almost a dessert in itself except for the trademark measure of hops by FFF.  Great stuff.

Bottle, 2007.  Pours a nice amberish color with a very small head.  Aroma is wonderful and I could sit and smell this for a very long time.  Vanilla, caramel, cookies, malts, dried fruits and some fruity and floral hops.  Flavor is not as hoppy as I expected and that is fine with me.  Vanilla, fruit, malts, caramel, toffee...lots of toffee.  This is afine beer!!

2007 bottle shared at tasting.  Poured clear amber with slight offwhtie head.  Aroma of malt, fruit, light hop.  Not as hoppy as I was expecting, though this was brewed two years ago.  Taste was similar with lots of malt, some fruit, and heavy sweetness.  Finish is, again, not as hop bitter as expected, though pretty nice.  Overalll, a solid effort, though a little below expectation.

08 Bottle from dpjuart, thanks Dave!  Poured a clear amber color with a moderate off-white head that faded to a ring.  Earthy, hoppy aroma with some caramel malts and pine, and a hint of citrus fruit.  Smooth, lightly sweet entry with some caramel, brown sugar, and a bit of hoppy spice including some pine and a light citrus fruitiness (orange, tangerine).  Finishes moderately bitter.  Moderate carbonation, decent bite on the palate.

A Mes rate: bottle at the Harry vs Wolfman fist fight.Clean dark copper coloured with a thin beige head. Big hoppy aroma with a load of sugary malt that never quite balances if you ask me. Nice enough though. Massive thick malty flavour with a load of sugary toffee. Sweet as hell and probably too much for many but it hit the spot for me. Good bitterness in the finish from the very floral hops. Not the most complex of brews, in fact it’s a rather basic big malt big hops type thing but there is enough fruity character to add some interest. Somehow the alcohol remains very well behaved too. Very good stuff.

2008 bomber purchased from Archer Liquors.  I’ve really been wanting to have this one.... it is a really solid American Barley WIne... but I think the price is a bit high at ~$15/bottle.  pours a brilliant red with a big white fluffy head.  as soon as I popped the top, I could smell the citrus based hops... but once in the glass it was subdued a bit... there is a very nice grapefruit hop aroma along with some caramel malts.  This barley wine is extremely well balanced and is a pure pleasure to drink.  It has a nice medium body with the hops taking over on top while the sides are fuller and full of malts.  A clean yet intense finish filled with bitterness a touch of alcohol and smooth malts.  A definite winner.

2007 75cl bottle from Party Pak Liqours (Indianapolis, IN). Pours a dark hazy brown with thin white head. Little glass lacing. Aroma is malt, maple syrup, hops, brown sugar, candy sugar, molasses. Flavor is much of the same with some pine and woody notes, sour malt, and some tanginess. Full body with a sightly sweet and slightly bitter finish.

Pours cloudy amber, with an aroma of sweet brown sugar and alcohol.  The hops are the first and last thing I taste.  For a barleywine, that is very interesting and unexpected.  It balances a sweet and slightly sour sugar, caramel, and malty undertone.  Really a fantastic barleywine.  Where can I get the other types of Behemoth?

Yellow wax: 2007 bottle.  Pours a murky reddish-brown.  Tiny off-white head.  Aroma is bourbon, figs, brown sugar, candy sugar, dark fruit, some hops, and lots of ethers.  Flavor is spice, dark fruit, cinnamon, wood, earth, bite, and pepper.  Finish is spicey with a wood, cinnamon, whiskey, and dark fruit.  Lacey glass afterwards; along with the flavor of lemon, lime, rosemary, and gummy sweetness.  Lots of flavor crammed in one beer that revels itself slowly and surely.  Like drinking a suckerpunch, if you’re not into barleywines.
An excellent production. Amazing smoothness with great hop balance. The alcohol is extremely well hidden. This lives up to the hype and I would recommend it to anyone who can get ahold of it.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2009 Bottle at the Angry Fist of Santa tasting at Chris os.  Thanks Harry.  Hazey reddish amber with thin beige head.  Aroma of lovely grapefruit hop.  Really nice, bit of musty malt as well, really lovely hop, a bit minty.  Not as good as something like old crustacean, bit musty and oxidised.  Bit too sweet. 3.2/5 Re-rate Bottle at LCRBM 5 at Kulminator.  Hazy copper no head.  Quite nice good big US hops typical US barley wine, but done well.

Another thanks to my cousin for a glass of this top 1 percent brew.  This is strong, sweet, malty stuff.   I noticed a lot of fruit and a little yeast in the rich flavor.  I am not always a huge fan of barleywines, but I enjoyed this a lot.

Zeeland 08’ tasting.  2008 bottle.  Some how I haven’t tried this one yet.  And honestly I had heard differing opinions on this one.  Poured dark brown.  Aroma was nice citrus and deep malt.  Taste was much the same with some dark fruit and a great balance between sharp citrus hops and big malt.  This one earned my respect.

2008 bomber. Finally got this one but was way too hot for me. The aroma was full of alcohol and brown sugar. The appearance was a nice dark brown with some red highlights, fluffy head. The taste was really hot and boozey with some malt thrown in there somewhere. Predominate caramel sweetness nicley balnced by peppery spice that stretches inot a long bitter finish. Not my cup of tea, needed more balance.

Yellow 2007 bottle thanks to lb4lb.
An amazing barley wine!  Pours a caramel amber with almost nonexistent tan head.  Tastes of molasses, with fruits like raisins and grapefruit.  Easy on the palate with a warming alcohol feeling.

Purple waw - 2008 edition. Three Floyds allways appeares in nice wrapping..love it. Pours a deep amber with a tan head. Aroma is a bit like christmas - with cloves, dry fruits add to that tons of american hops. Strong vinoes taste with fruity hoppy overwhelming notes. Best barlywine ive had to this date. Finish long and bittersweet..
Bottle, 2007.  Excellent.  Best barleywine I’ve had.  Palate is extremely smooth, short, sweet finish.  Soft carbonation and a fruity aroma with caramel and vanilla notes round it out.

[Bottle] Pours a hazy, caramelly gold with a medium beige head. Aroma is strong with citric hops, caramel-toffee, a touch of raisin, and a little alcohol. Flavor is very caramelly and rich, warming alcohol doesn’t detract from the flavor. Pine and citric hops add flavor and bitterness. Overall a good beer.

Bottle @ Chris_os Pre-Beer Exposed Tasting, September 2008.
Pours a very pretty red with a small, creamy, off-white head. Aroma is powerfully hoppy, light strawberries, melons and lots of caramel. Fine, dry mouthfeel. Flavour is softly sweet, fine caramel and dried fruits. Good, high hoppiness. But it feels a bit ’old’ and rather dull - especially compared to that inflated average rating.

2008 bottle Pours amber with a small off white head.  Aroma is dominated by citrusy hops.  Flavor is grapefruit, caramel malt, ripe fruit, and maybe a hint of licorice.  Would probably be better with some cellaring.

Bottle, 2007. Heavy malt aromas of cereal and caramel, moderate orange for the hops, and dough for the yeast, with date, apple, brown sugar and slight hint of anise. Head is small, frothy, slightly off white, with good lacing, and is mostly diminishing. Color is muddy tan. Flavor starts moderately to heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidc, moderately bittersweet and a touch sour. Palate is medium to full, between creamy and syrupy, with a soft carbonation. Rich in aromas and an excellent balance in flavors.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2008 Another big tip of the hat to General Gao for this 650 ml, 2007 yellow wax bottle. Translucent, dark copper-brown with a small but enduring head that leaves a cream on the glass. Earth-spicy caramel and chocolate bar aroma also has some hints of citrus. Flavor starts similarly but is nearly taken away by orange-aspirin, pepper and resin hop flavors. Some oak and slight alcohol are also present. Medium-heavy body is smoothly carbonated and dryish, but almost too sticky.

22 oz 2007 bottle.  Very complex and strong aroma, much more pronounced hop that most barely wines with a good citrus/grapefruit, along with a sweet red berry, very minor alcohol, and a distinct molasses.  Small clean white head on the pour, minimal lacing, but a beautiful look otherwise with solid ruby red color.
